Reviews.Title: “Great location, service”
Reviews.Author: NatsDad
Reviews.Content: This the 3rd Club Quarters we have used having previously stayed at locations in London and Chicago. The location is excellent, room was very clean and the front desk staff were great. The only downside was that the bed wasn't as comfortable as the London and Chicago locations. The location is great and most everything is within walking distance or a short trip on the subway. For those arriving into Logan avoid the $25 cab fare. There is a free shuttle bus to the Blue Line subway station. Buy a $2 ticket and take the 3 stops to State St and it is a 2 minute walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying on the whole”
Reviews.Author: LWBS
Reviews.Content: Like the good and convenient location. Staffs are friendly and ready to help, so are the cleaning ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want, at the best location”
Reviews.Author: sammmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 4 days in early March. Compared to others in the area the Club Quarters was well priced and maintained a strong TA rating. Deservedly so. The room was clean and spacious for such a central location. There was also plenty of storgae space and free filtered water. There is a coffee machine in the room but no tea (you can not get good tea anywhere in Boston!!). The communal area, the club room, also has free refreshements and newspapers and free internet and printer. The hotel is connected to an English styled pub which has a good atmosphere and good food. The hotel is possibly in the best spot in Boston. As a city small enough to walk, the Club Quaters is ideally positioned between Boston Common (10min walk) and the shopping area of town (Newbury St 20min walk) in one direction and Faneuiel Hall (5min walk) and the North End (Little Italy 15 min walk) in the other. Because the hotel is in the financial district the area around the hotel is very quiet at the weekend. Given the price we paid, we were extatic with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous P
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there one night but we had a lot of special circumstances that required some additional service (religious shabbath observers) and they were extremely accommodating! They never let on that they were annoyed or confused by our practices - they were curious and happy to help! The room were clean and nice - a tab small but a really great use of space! The night staff - Jason and Julian were particularly helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Katie S
Reviews.Content: My family went to visit Boston recently and stayed at the Club Quarters Boston. This is a really nice hotel, clean and modern facilities, friendly staff and most of all, great location - 5 minutes walk to the Quincy Market and Freedom trail, 7 minutes to the North End, and all the subway lines are within a few blocks. The rooms were a bit small but clean. You would have to call for extra towels but the deliveries were instantaneous. They also provided complementary purified water and coffee, as well as free luggage storage on the day of check out. All of the staff were very friendly. One of the managers, Hsin Ti, was especially helpful in making sure our stay was pleasant and patiently answered all our questions on getting around, recommended restaurants and sightseeing spots etc. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, clean hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right in the center of Downtown. It was a few blocks from the Freedom Trail & Feneuil Hall. It was clean. Beds were comfy. Staff was friendly. Prices were reasonable. They offer free coffee from the Keurig 24/7 & purified water in bottles on every floor. The only negatives were there is no parking (it cost $40 from Friday night to Sunday at noon) at 33 Arch St & the hotel does not offer discounts there & the room was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for some”
Reviews.Author: martys2cents
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times, and each time it has been pretty good. Rooms are small, tv's are small, no mini bar or anything like that. Its a business travelers hotel, so the frills are not there. The beds are a bit hard, and they had no extra pillows or blankets available. On my last trip I found out that the doors to the rooms have no soundproofing at all. I was awoken several times by people talking in the hall, and it sounds as if the door is open. Always clean and the employees are always friendly and helpful. In the end, I will stay elsewhere from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: BrenK_12
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for one night to celebrate a delayed valentines. After having dinner and bar hopping throughout fenuille hall we came back to the room to crash. The location could not have been better and though our stay was short, the little touches like our towels folded into elephants and warm welcoming receptionist made us feel like we were valued regulars. This cozy nook is our new secret staycation and will be seeing more of us shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service...”
Reviews.Author: MinayaM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Club Quarters this past Presidentâ€™s Day weekend and we had a great time. Julian the front desk gentleman was extremely friendly and very helpful. He would give us tips, where to dine and sightsee. . We enjoyed our stayed at this hotel and would definitely stay here again, when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Larkers85
Reviews.Content: I first found out about this hotel through our corporate booking agent. It really is a hidden gem in Boston for the cost concious business or leisure traveller. It's best described as "compact" but the rooms are perfectly functional. It's an easy walk to the Finanical District, and Fenuille Hall, as well as other major tourist attractions. The hotel itself adjoins the excellent Elephant & Castle Pub; but room service can come from many local restaurants. For value for money I don't think this place can be beaten in it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price-Quality Ration, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: celiacelia
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at club quarters in one of the coldest weekends of the winter. The hotel was small but impressively comfortable, the staff at the reception was very helpful and the location was great. We'll definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service, location”
Reviews.Author: flisa32
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit small but the price is phenomenal for what you get. Dont know how they make a profit. Super nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “All requests were Completed to full expectation with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: Cts92986
Reviews.Content: Customer service is what brings me back somewhere, and club quarters is doing everything right. A native resident in the area, a few friends and I reserved 3 Kitchenette suits with a full size bed and pull out couch to enjoy the evening in town. The rooms are amazingly priced and spacious. The room slept 5 comfortably (if you don't mind sharing A bed with your girlfriends) and the staff would make you think you are royalty. Julian ( the front desk attendant) was informative, professional, and eager to please all of the guests needs. There are even refillable purified water dispensers on every floor, perfect for hangover prevention. All in all, fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent service”
Reviews.Author: marcohdzm
Reviews.Content: I'd like to acknowledge Marina Navarro, she has done an excellent work! I feel truly comfortable ere

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: amber1027
Reviews.Content: I have to give this place a rave review. I can't honestly think of one negative point I found. For the price and location in Downtown Boston Financial District you can't go wrong. Easy walking to Fanuel Hall/Quincy Market, Boston Common, even a cab from the airport is pretty cheap. They even had a cab waiting outside of the hotel door when I checked out at 6am on a Sunday. Loved the clean room. Bathroom spotless, linens spotless, walls clean and the carpet is so clean you don't have to fear walking on it barefoot. Descent sized, even with many bags you don't feel cramped. Nice flat screen tv and heater/ac in room so you can control the temperature, black out curtains, coffee maker. Check in and out is fantastically fast and the front desk girls who greeted me at the door were great. Free wifi, free internet on computers in the lounge and if that's not enough you can even print your boarding pass for free. Free connectors for computers in the rooms and in the lounge. Also free filtered water on each floor and a closet to grab extra blankets and ironing boards, irons, extra coffee ect. There is also an Elephant & Castle Pub adjacent to the hotel making it easy to grab a quick bite or a drink. I wish every hotel was like this and there would be no need for tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights stay at the club quarters Boston”
Reviews.Author: Pmg1975
Reviews.Content: Interesting concept here, you check in yourself, via a touch screen. You get an impression that this is a no frills stay you are about to undertake. The room was fine, I booked a standard room, it had a king size bed, coffee maker, flat screen tv, great black out curtains. Adequate bathroom. Ok the negatives. I was unfortunate to have a room with an adjoining door and the guy next door felt he had to listen to sad eighties love songs and sing along to them at 2 am !! Yes this could happen in any hotel I agree. Just sharing my experience, the noise travels easily through the two back to back doors. Breakfast is by room service, it arrives in a box and was not one I will remember in years to come. I recommend going down to the Elephant and Castle which adjoins the hotel, great atmosphere in the evenings too. If you consider how much you are paying for this experience I think it's worth considering, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay !”
Reviews.Author: Reitei
Reviews.Content: A nice pleasant Stay, ideally Situated, The staff named Hsinti at front desk was friendly and helpful. Would definitely return !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Close to Faneiul Hall Area & Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Quarters for the first time on a Friday night. This was in a great location with only a 5-8 minute walk to Faneiul Hall or downtown stores on Washington Street. It is about a 10 min. walk to South Station where all the buses come in if you riding a bus into Boston. I was able to walk over to Faneiul Hall for a great meal in the afternoon and also checked out the stores downtown. The internet was great and free. Water is free on each floor. The rooms are compact I guess compared to some larger hotels but EXCELLENT in design I thought with everything you would need. Very clean and neat. I actually will start looking to stay at Club Quarters at other cites they are in when I travel next. They are a pleasant surprise when other hotels are charging much more. Front desk personnel (Jason) was very cordial and gave great directions.

Reviews.Title: “Boston lovers”
Reviews.Author: debbie2373
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location,only about 20 mins from the station.Our room was very small but we were only sleeping in it,it was clean thats the most important to me. Well worth the money. The bar attached to this hotel was expensive for eating so best to look around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ThiaStThomas
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 6 nights over Christmas, and we were pleasantly surprised. We were a slight bit aprehensive since it is supposed to be for business travelers, and might not have had the ammenities we were used to. The room was modern, clean, although a bit small. But the size of the room was not a dealbreaker. We wanted a hotel close to the highway, but yet close to the sites of Boston. The location was much better than we expected. Only 2 blocks to Faneuil Hall, 2 blocks to shopping, 8 minutes walk to Chinatown, and lots of restaurants within minutes walk, (also, hop on the "T" (subway), and you are anywhere in minutes. We self parked, and was only a block away, not bad. The coffee and tea in am & pm was great. Staff went out of their way to make our stay the best. We visit Boston a couple times a year, and will be staying at The Club Quarters from now on!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: paul m
Reviews.Content: we had i an incrediable night at Club Quarters and a great time in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: paul b
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over Christmas and the room was very clean great shower comfortable bed and nice and quiet. The cleaner came in every morning and done a great job. The front desk staff were outstanding and went out of their way to help you. The Elephant and Castle pub next door was great for their choice of beers and food available. All in all if i went to Boston again this would be my first choice Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from Xmas overnight”
Reviews.Author: fruscib
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston to see my kids overnight...hotel and city were very quiet but the room was clean...hot strong shower in the AM...thought my tv remote was dead desk delivered one in 3 minutes. Very friendly staff. Room is spacious for city room if you think it is small stay in NYC, they are small. Love the water bottles and Keurig coffee in the AM. Elephant and Castle is a nice comfy welcoming place to get a bite and a drink. Would stay again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: mjd2007
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip to Boston so I tagged along. His work had put us up in a nice hotel but after his work was done we decided to stay a few days at a hotel we could afford. I was a bit hesitant about staying in the financial district however after looking at map we booked our room because it didn't seem far from the hub of things. In fact Club Quarters is practically in the middle of things. Depending on what your looking for if course. It is a minutes walk from part if the freedom trail. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. Overall this hotel worked out perfectly! The restaurant downstairs was really fun also! If your in Boston on a budget or even if you aren't I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: CarrieJkn
Reviews.Content: Overall, a really good hotel, especially for the price. Used the valet parking as other reviews indicated self parking was difficult to get to. Overall service was very good, all staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but we would come back”
Reviews.Author: Tim_and_Jen_from_RI
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarter Boston is primarily a utilitarian facility with a bit of style thrown in. The pros are: their rates, cleanliness, security, peace and quiet and dÃ©cor that does not remind you that you are staying in a discount facility. We found only one significant draw back and that was the bed. I had asked for a double/full size bed and what we got was two single beds pushed together. To make matters worse the bed was not very comfortable and not as long as a standard bed. The bedding problem may be related directly to our room size, we reserved the smallest of their rooms, the size of which reminded me of a Manhattan hotel room. I recommend this facility for the business traveler, the facility is in the middle of the financial district and there is direct access to a better than average pub which shares part of the street level space. I would also recommend the facility to the cost conscious personal traveler who is ok staying a bit off Bostonâ€™s tourist routes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MVTraveler31
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located with a cheerful and helpful staff. The rooms are basic, clean, and small. All extras - pillows, iron and ironing board, blankets, tissue, etc are stored in a common hallway closet where you help yourself. The extra pillows were in a sorry state, so I passed. There is complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning. Overnight parking is available at $16 - a great rate for Boston - if you park yourself. Just be sure you go down the alley and under the building and not around the block - or you will circle again. Average value, but great location for the event I attended. The rate was comparable to other locations with better ammenities. May be worth it for the sake of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: di_lithium
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a great location at a good price. Within walking distance, and I mean reasonable walking distance, of South Station, Quincy Market, Boston Common, coffee, and more. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. While the hallways are straight, the rooms are angled so your door is right next to your neighbor's so I did hear when people came and went but no big deal. The walls are a bit thin; I could hear my neighbor's phone conversation clearly, so just keep that in mind. I have seen where some people say the room is small. I saw only my room so I can't really comment in general, but my room was large certainly by big city standards and I was only sleeping there so it was more than adequate for that. The chilled water dispensers and bottles on each floor is a nice touch which I appreciated. Grab a fresh bottle of chilled water on your way out for the day. There is a room off reception where you can check your email, print your boarding pass, and have a coffee. For a major city and in a wonderful location, the price is reasonable and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2 Nights in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Brisa03
Reviews.Content: So we just spent two nights at the Club Quartes in Boston. The negative up front. The rediculous atm check in/check out system which is status quo for Club Quarters. If you have an issue at check in, then you walk over to the person at the desk and the assist you. Which we did and they did. Why not just check in like every other hotel in the world? Secondly, we had a closet that was six inches wide. This is great if you are checking in with your assorted pool cues and starched jump rope collection. On the positive. Friendly staff, Excellent FREE bottle water dispenser on every floor. Location was superb. Less than a five minute walk to the State House T station and the Park Line T station. Elephant and Pub connected to hotel was quite convenient. Would definitely stay again even with the irritating atm check in check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: augustam830
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Boston, to we had no idea where to stay when planning our anniversary trip. I found the Club Quarters and thought it looked "ok" for the price. When we got there, I was pleasantly surprised! The rooms are clean and small, which is fine if you're going to spend most of your time site-seeing. We had a room with a view of a building across the street, but didn't hear any street noise. They do have valet, but we just took public transportation from the airport, which was so easy! The hotel is connected to a bar, so we ate (and drank) there often during our stay. It's also just a few doors down from a liquor store. The best thing about this hotel is its location! We were within walking distance to Quincy Market, tons of bars and restaurants, the Freedom Trail, the harbor and the aquarium! The staff was also very helpful. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: LittleStepsChloe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money, as it was located in a good spot in the financial district and within close walking distance to most of the tourist spots in Boston. The rooms were a bit basic and quite small but overall was very good value for money. The hotel has a nice look and feel and the club lounge was particularly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Matilda F
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a quiet street (at least on the weekend, assumly also in the evenings), Freedom Trail and breakfast locations just around the corner, for dining possibly not the best location (but 10-15 minutes walk to Italian quarter). I walked to everywhere except Harvard. Tube to airport station is a 5 minutes walk (and takes 8 minutes). Room was OK, nice shower, but toilet hardly useable as squeezed under sink. But small but I was one person only. I liked the filtered water in the hall. Fair price for Boston and I cannot imagine a better location, I would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Avarage”
Reviews.Author: RadioDummie
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Club Quarters in Boston. It was just avarage. The service is not poor, in my honest opinion, it is just basic. No bar in the room, just a water despencer in the middle of the floor. Good free wi-fi connection. Excellent the pub just under the hotel. The food is good and it is very populated. Very near St. Antony Shrine, a catholic church: good if you are interested in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Yasufujio
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay at Club Quarters during my 4 days visit to Boston. I chose to stay at this hotel primarily because of its location. Not only was the location excellent for my purpose, the room was very clean and comfortable with easy free wifi connection, the street was quiet at night, in the lobby there was a couple of pcs and printer as well as free coffee available to all the customers, and above all the staff were all very kind and friendly. I was most of the time served by one of the staff members called Cindy, a lady from Taiwan. She was very nice and helpful and always made me feel so comfortable that I was actually excited to go back to the hotel every evening. I would definitely come back here for my next visit to Boston. I highly recommend Club Quarters for anyone who would like to have a good time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Manabu s
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location. Its close to many attractions as well as many great shops and restaurants/bars. Very helpful front desk manager Miss Cindy Hou. Informative about some of the best restaurants and bars around town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: wanderj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a central location. The filtered water stations on each floor is a nice touch. They provide bottles or you can just refill your own. The staff is attentive and very friendly. When we were there Beverly was quick to help when I needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Has ALL the Necessities!”
Reviews.Author: michellebe713
Reviews.Content: Yes, Club Quarters may be a small hotel but it does the job. Besides, it's not like visitors spend all day in the room. It's well kept and extremely comfortable despite the fact the rooms are small. The bathrooms are well maintained and everything is refreshed nicely. Also can't complain about the free coffee in the lobby. It's in a good location but if you are looking to go out at night, you may have to walk a few blocks to catch a cab. Otherwise the staff can call one for you and they are very friendly especially Mike who is extremely helpful and awesome! I would definitely stay here again and strongly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Guillou_Guillou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in the heart of Boston. Everything was good but the staff could be more helpful. I did not like the self-check in... maybe it is the only way to make the room cheaper. However, everyone seems confused with the self-check in so I don't see the point of having that.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff; Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Judy_A_4thTee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Boston for the weekend. Staff member, Mike Squadrito, very nice, pleasant and helpful. Perfect location; close to Faneuil Hall, North End and shopping. Love staying here......3rd time and counting..... Judy - Falmouth

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JPL66
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Boston for a number of years now and always stay at Club Quarters. The hotel has been reinventing and renovating itself over the past few years and has become even more comfortable with each incarnation. As comfortable as it is, however, it is the hotel staff that makes me want to return with each visit to Boston. One staff member who has been particularly helpful over the years is Michael Squadrito. He, of course, knows the hotel and ensures a pleasant stay, but he also is an excellent source of information about the area around the hotel (Faneuil Hall, Chinatown, The North End, the harbor, etc.). I highly recommend Club Quarters for anyone visiting Boston. It's Well-maintained, well-located, well-priced and well-staffed. Jim Lowell

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RICARDO S
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters it's a good located hotel, I like how the rooms are always very clean and the good service that it provides, Specially the service from Michael at the front desk helping me with any answers to my questions also Felix who always provides me a good service with anything that I might need. I would like to come back again to this hotel. Thx. a lot for your attentions!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service”
Reviews.Author: Cesar P
Reviews.Content: The location and price is very good. The service of Mike Squadrito is excelent, always he was friendly and worried for the confort of the host. The Pub Elephant and Casttle is a good choice to eat and drink in any moment.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo H
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel! the situation is near by the best points of the city!! The best service in the front desk from Michael Squadrito, he always helped me to what ever i need with smile in his face and the best attitude

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Club Quarters Boston. Hotel was very clean, in a great location near the 'T' and all hotel staff I encountered were very friendly and accomodating. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, nothing special, good location”
Reviews.Author: skiguy33
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a convention and this was a great location to stay. The hotel is located in the financial district and was a 10 minute walk to the convention center or a few minutes by cab. Club Quarters is an economy class hotel for business travelers. It delivers on that, thus the average rating. Nothing special...clean room, rooms slightly dated, limited amenities. The restaurant attached is convenient but they really need people who speak english clearly! If I needed to stay in Boston again for basic accomodations this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Symmesgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the weekend at the hotel. It was a very busy weekend in Boston so we were unable to stay at a hotel that we knew and the prices were more expensive also. The hotel itself is all right. The room was very clean and nice but very small. There was no nightstand on my size of the bed because there was no room for it. There was no dresser and only a two shelf bureau in the closet because it wouldn't fit anywhere else. The bathroom had only a shower and it was utilitarian. We also noticed that although we had a king bed, it was really two twins put together so there was a definite line between the mattresses. I'm wondering if a real king sized mattress would fit in the narrow hallway to the room and be hard to handle once it was in the room. If you want to be in downtown Boston, then it's a good location. We had trouble with our GPS because it couldn't get satellite reception in the area and there are a lot of very narrow one way streets so driving is an adventure. The hotel also does not have its own parking garage. It does have arrangements with a garage about two blocks away. The rate is actually very good especially for weekends. The hotel has no restaurants or facilities for breakfast. There is a restaurant next door where you can eat and charge your meal to your room. Overall, it was all right but we have stayed at five other hotel in the Boston area because both of our sons attend college there and we visit often and this is my least favorite so far.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfo-ord-bos
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights. a relatively small hotel. really nothing luxury. machines in the lobby for automatic check-ins. good location. rooms are clean and comfortable. quiet at night. like the water bottle filling stations on every floor, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest of the club quarters”
Reviews.Author: barrhalevi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in expensive Boston. Last minute travel changes and overbooked hotels led to splitting room with a colleague. Big mistake. Previous experiences in the "suite" of CQ hotels in Philly, Chicago, and NYC had a good sized room with comfortable pull out bed. Not here- the rooms were tiny, and the pull out bed horrible. Staff was helpful, if not friendly. I dont see staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot!”
Reviews.Author: choclo_265
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here strictly based on price and location. Yes, the rooms are small but not cramped and I wasn't in Boston to sleep in a uber luxury hotel. The bathroom was surprisingly large. My only quip was the toilet, the flusher doo-hickey is like the ones in a public restroom. The staff was always nice. I loved the dispenser of free filtered water and bottles on each floor. The elevators were accessible only by your room key, a nice touch for safety. I was able to walk everywhere! From south station, to the harbor, to boston commons. Overall, worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service”
Reviews.Author: RodgerTompskins
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters itself was clean and the staff was absolutely extraordinary in their dealings with customers. Mike at the front desk goes above and beyond during checkin/checkout and always recommends great restaurants in the neighborhood. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel at any time. Thanks again Mike!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Business travelers”
Reviews.Author: dmacbean
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel had everything that a business traveler needs; location direct in financial district and within a 2 minute walk of T line. The wi-fi was free and each room (i had standard) has desk area for working. The rooms are 'efficiency rooms' so they are small but really I was expecting worse after some of the reviews I read and it did not feel small because they utilize the space so well. They have wall mounted flat screen tv, wall mounted lamps and the bathroom uses lots of wall space. The shower head was fantastic pressure etc - although the shower is small was one thing that i felt and I am small woman. The pub that is next door / attached has pretty good food - I had the bangers and mash one day and the salmon another and both were cooked nicely. Breakfast is also very good. The lobby is a bit small but does have an area to hang out. One huge plus was that in the lobby and on each floor they have free bottled water - or rather free filtered water with free bottles that you can take. I loved this! The other huge plus is location. It is within walking distance of many stores and shopping - only about 5 min walk to Fanhiel hall (sp?) and about 12 min walk to Italian North End and 7 mins to the water and aquarium. The only folks I would not recommend this hotel to is family simply because of the room size since most kids need room to spread out w/ their stuff. But for singles or even couples this hotel is great. The rates for standard rooms are good and security was great. I found the staff very friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline J
Reviews.Content: This is our first time in a club quarters property, and I would return to another based on the Boston experience. Although pricey (we came here through a "secret hotel" deal on Hotwire so it was a bit cheaper than other rates available) the hotel is modern, clean and has most of the amenities expected. We stayed in a standard room, which is not large, but has enough space for a couple on a weekend visit to the city, and would be fine for the solo business person. It is no fuss, with staff which are pleasant, but not overbearing, so it would be perfect for business, as there is a good internet connection, a decent desk space and coffee available on tap in the lounge. The bar adjoining has a reasonable menu there are some other options nearby through the week. At a weekend one needs to travel further afield, as the hotel is in the business district, which closes down after the work week. Since this is a vacation rather than business travel, we haven't visited the fitness room, but I thought it was interesting to note that they advertise that certain machines can even be brought to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: LOVENATLPARKS
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a pleasant 3 days at the Club Quarters in Boston. My wife and I had a standard room on the eleventh floor. The room was clean and quiet, even a bit larger than we expected. The staff was very professional and helpful. The hotelâ€™s location is terrific, just a few blocks to many Boston landmarks such as the Faneuil Hall, the Boston Common, etc. Our longest journeys from the hotel were the Freedom Trail walk to Bunker Hill (we returned by the Charlestown-Long Wharf ferry) and the subway ride to Cambridge to visit the Harvard campus. Room service breakfast was acceptable although I would have preferred that it be served on plates rather than in delivery boxes. We enjoyed dinner at McCormack and Schmitts at the nearby Quincy Marketplace. Besides being passÃ©, Cheers in the Quincy Marketplace just doesnâ€™t have good food. A better choice for dinner was the Boston Sail Loft on the harbor (Atlantic Street). I booked our rooms through the Southwest Airlines web-site and was pleased with the rate. Iâ€™d recommend staying at the Club Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal lodging for Biz and Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: MBPillen
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters was a major find! It's located close to the Fanueil Hall Marketplace, within walking distance of the North End and several T stops, and a hop, jump, and skip to some of the more interesting historical sites in Boston. I travel a lot for business and this hotel was ideal: modern, clean, free Wifi, extras (iron, ironing board, pillows) located in an accessible closet on each floor. The furniture was mobile, lighting was great, and the desk was actually set up for someone to work at. It was also very quiet at night! My husband stayed a couple of nights with me before the business part of our trip, so we took advantage of its ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & convenient, plus a good price”
Reviews.Author: FolkFestival2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Quarters for three days during the week. It was clean and very convenient for T stops, restaurants, and some sightseeing. It's a reasonable cab fare from the airport. The price was better than any other downtown Boston hotel that I checked on. My room was surprisingly quiet given there was some evening construction work going on across the street. The staff were all helpful. I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Emily P
Reviews.Content: My friends and I travelled to Boston on Sept. 2/11 for the weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday and to experience a city that none of us had ever visited. I will skip the long list of negatives that occurred due to our choice to fly Porter-which included a 5 hour delay (apparently due to fog that occurred 9 hours earlier), my baggage being lost, missing the Red Sox game due to said delay and not being able to get a hold of anyone that worked for Porter after hours of trying half a dozen phone numbers. So to skip all that, this is a rave review for Club Quarters! They were absolutely amazing, excelling in their unequalled customer service!! They did everything they could to help with my luggage, including calling some of the numbers themselves to try to track someone down that may have know where my luggage was. And they were never annoyed when I would pop by or call every few minutes to see if it had shown up yet..And when it did, over 30 hours later, Mike at the front desk was almost excited as I was! I have stayed at many hotels, but I haven't ever experienced such a personal touch from the staff members as I had at Club Quarters. They were helpful with directions, suggestions, tips-you name it, they could help in some way. Even the first night, when we were short 2 pillows, they searched high and low, at 1am and found 2 and then gave all 6 of us complimentary breakfast at the great restaurant next door-with wonderful Mike as our waiter. Jason and Mike really stood out for us but every single staff member that we came in contact with, which I believe would be all of them, were spectacular! My friends and I hope to make this Boston trip an annual thing and wouldn't consider staying at any other place than Club Quarters!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stone1212
Reviews.Content: I have used Club Quarters in other cities but this was the first time in Boston. It was an excellent place and I will certainly use it on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Yrahcaz
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel makes is a great place to stay if you're doing the "Freedom Trail" and most other historic downtown sites. Being between and not that far from the various "T" lines, made getting around to the other parts of Boston (Cambridge, Fenway Park, etc... a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value in Heart Of Boston”
Reviews.Author: GrantNeck
Reviews.Content: I don't hand out 5-star reviews willy-nilly. I consider a 3 the baseline, Club Quarters earned their 5 stars on a great cost/quality ratio. When we were looking to book a two night mini-vacation in downtown Boston we considered cost, proximity to Freedom Trail-esq sites and mass transit. Not only was Club Quarters the cheapest hotel in its class in the area but it offered everything else as well. T-Stop 2 blocks away, right in the heart of the Freedom Trail, really solid pub/restaurant on site, and the rooms while a bit small, were very nicely appointed. If you plan on spending alot of time in your room, this may have been an issue, but we were basically there to rest/clean up and get back out. For this, it was perfect. The staff was also exceptionally friendly and were very helpful with out bag-check needs as we arrived early and departed the city late. I'll ding them on two places 1) They like to nickle and dime you. Extra key? $15 (they assume it means extra person) Early check-in for internet rate guests? $35. 2) The showers were really tiny. These would have cost them a star if they hadn't been the cheapest in the area, but they were, by a mile. All in all, we'll definitely look to stay here again as long as they keep their prices down because they really offer a great stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Moneck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during a business trip. All the expenses were payed by the company, so I cant say much about the price. What I can say though is that the room was bettet than expected and the service was excellent. People at the rest and front dedk were great. I specially remember Mike who I met at the front desk but also saw him at the rest. Always very attentive and making sure I was having a good experience, he even took my breakfast to the room when it wasnt his responsability only to make sure it wasnt delayed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Patsymn
Reviews.Content: For an expensive town like Boston, it was nice to find and stay in a clean and reasonably priced hotel. In our room we had a microwave and fridge which would have been super handy, if we were staying more than a night. They have convenient water dispensers with free bottles that you can fill. Definiately will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “You won't be late!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda R
Reviews.Content: I flew in from the West coast and had a horrible time with the time difference. Spoke to Mike S. about it and he was a huge help! Would do extra wake up calls and even brought coffee up to me in the morning from the lobby! I wasn't late from their help. Will definately stay here again when my company sends me back...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at CQ. The staff were very helpful especially Michael who goes out of his way to help you. Rooms were spotless and the beds were very comfortable. I would definitely revisit this hotel and his has a lot to do with the great service I got here. I was left wanting for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but more a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: auffretbaudot
Reviews.Content: Best possible location in Boston: Beacon Hill, Freedom Trail and business district as well as Waterfront are within a short walking distance. The bed for our 11-year grand son was very poor. Once set, no room to move. Kitchenette very symbolic. Breakfast: poor. Certainly good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Club!”
Reviews.Author: beth915
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through Priceline - had stayed in Boston several times but never heard of Club Quarters. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. They anticipated the needs of my friends and I; Very accomodating. The hotel was clean and well-kept. Our stay was for fun, but I imagine this is a great place to stay for business travelers. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to Fanueil Hall and nightlife. I'll definitely visit the Club again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kusue_74
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located within walking distance of many historical sites in Boston, the CQ Boston is the most reasonably priced hotel we could find. The staff (we dealt mostly with Beverly and Michael) was extremely helpful and courteous. The filtered water and bottles available in the hall on each floor added a nice touch. Comfortable beds and a good shower made the rooms more than acceptable. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends traveling to Boston. It is a little bit hard to find, but the Bostonians were extremely helpful in giving directions.

Reviews.Title: “Mike at front desk goes extra mile to help.”
Reviews.Author: Eric_l777
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. Unloaded bags out front, checked in, and when going back to park car it was dead. Mike S at front desk got jumper cables for me, called AAA, and even waited 30 mins after his shift to make sure tow truck arrived. Couldn't have been nicer, very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Fu C
Reviews.Content: The location is good. The room is comfortable. The wifi is free and all along accessible. The service is perfect. For the first night, they did not have available room and I was transferred to a suite room in a 4 start hotel. All fee including taxi are paid by them. Also, I got some compensation after I checked in. Cindy and Michael are pretty helpful! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Club Quarters for two night. The hotel was very nice and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I was very unfamiliar with the city but Mike Squadrito was very helpful in helping me find suitable parking close by. He also suggested tours and excursions in the Boston area that proved to be quiet entertaining. I really think it makes a difference to your trip when the staff are as courteous as they were in Club Quarters. I will happily return and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything basic - a bargain in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked Club Quarter as it was the cheapest option and also close to the Ritz Carlton where I had an early meeting. Nothing wrong with it although it was not the sort of hotel you'd really enjoy staying. A decent business hotel with reasonable price and the free in-room WiFi was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Should be half the price”
Reviews.Author: mrmnem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there on the sixth floor, for a 3-day weekend escape to Boston. Location is fine, at walking distance of many points of interest. Other than that, we have been rather disappointed with our stay: rooms are small, noisy (you can hear every person walking down the corridor, other people's TVs, etc), and we didn't sleep so well on the bed. The staff was rather nice as we checked in... much less as we checked out (not even a "goodbye" as we went out, that was a first). Let's also mention that nothing (breakfast, internet access, parking) is included in the listed price, and that makes a much overpriced hotel. For sure, it's summertime, and the city's full of tourists, but we ended up paying $700 for three nights... when I usually pay $100 / night for this kind of hotel. So, although it's a rather decent place (it's clean, rather new), I can't really recommend this hotel; I'm sure there's plenty of better deals in Boston - especially now, with the building on the other side of the street being under construction. I would come again... for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very professional and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: Companies I've worked for have put temporary employees up at this location, and the only complaint I've ever received was the size of the room(s). That is to be expected in downtown Boston, and the cleanliness and comfort was second to none for this style of hotel. Personally, I have sent family members to stay there, and they had nothing but great things to stay, especially about the gentleman at the desk (manager?), Mike. He made them feel very welcome, and he was very attentive to any needs that they had. I will continue to recommend the Club Quarters Boston. Mainly due to the fact that Mike is a guy I can contact and trust to see that my guests are well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Major building works currently”
Reviews.Author: GalwayTribe
Reviews.Content: There is a major building project going on right in front of the hotel and it is running all night. The noise is a major issue, but that hasn't stopped CQ renting out the rooms and offering me, wait for it, Ear Plugs! Despite sometimes iffy room cleanliness in the past I continued to stay here as it is good value for money, but this is probably the last straw.....

Reviews.Title: “Good security, clean, in the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: ReneeChas
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for the price in Boston. We had 4 people in a suite. It had a nice full size bed and a pullout couch bed. I would not even make small children sleep on the pull out bed. It was so bad I slept on the couch cushions on the floor. Other than that It was great. Centrally located to all areas of Boston on foot. Security great, valet parking down the street at the parking lot kind of a pain, but just take everything with you and don't have to go back to your car. They have to bring it to you at the desk even if you just want to get something out of it. Restaurant nice in the hotel. Also plenty of free bottled water, Staff is very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Capelle aan den IJssel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Real noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArjanS87
Reviews.Content: In general, the hotel rooms are roomy, modern and well kept. A manual climate control is also a huge pro these warm weeks. Friends of us on the third floor reported a very good nights rest everytime, yet we were given only a very little rest thanks to our fellow guests on the sixth floor. The first night, the adjoining room was filled with drunk guys arguing till 3.30 pm. We kept calling the service desk, but they didn't come up themselves before we threathened just to leave the hotel the next morning. After that, the guys were quiet (somewhat). The second night, there seemed to be a wedding reception across the hall after midnight. This time, we didn't wait till the service desk did something aboit it and send these people downstairs ourselves. In short, the hotel is allright. Yet the superthin walls are your curse when confronted with ignorant fellow guests. Also service could be way more pro-active

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room/location, great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: colemanhoward
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Boston for the first time on business, and decided to get a hotel a little closer to downtown and the financial district. The customer service provided by the staff really stood out, both at time of check in and the next morning when I had to leave my bags at the front desk while checking out the city and grabbing some brunch. The shower was one of the best showers I've ever has in a hotel room. Definitely recommend this location for travelers looking for a nice, quiet, clean stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aly0808
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night in July 2011. Room was a good size and clean, but looked a little tired. I would have liked to have had a mini fridge in the room, which apparently are supplied only in specific rooms for long stay guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Reim
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Club Quarters me and my partner were able to check-in in less than 2 minutes as they had automated computers for checking in which only required you to simply swipe your credit card! The room was average sized, and very comfortable overall. It was nicely designed and had a flat screen TV. The only negative point would be that there was no fan in the bathroom. There is free wifi in the rooms which works very well and is fast. Another plus is that there is a gym (2 treadmills, 2 bikes, 1 elliptical, and weights). The location of the hotel is in the financial district, but it is very close to several subway stops as well as within walking distance to major attractions and to little Italy. Overall this hotel offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: trlvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it was close to my business meeting. Location is great, being in the heart of Boston downtown. But the price, for what you get - is just way too high! When I checked in, the room I booked was not available, so I was 'upgraded'. I assumed it would mean, as implied - a better room! No. I got a room the size of a closet with 2 twin beds. Can't imagine what the 'standard' room would've been like. The walls are very thin, I listened to my neighbor's TV all night. There wasn't even an ironing board in the room - you have to go to 'utilities' closet in the hallway and get the board and an iron, and haul it back to your own room. But the room did have a Websters Dictionary in it, maybe that should've made up for all the other shortcomings. Probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk from this establishment!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous60745
Reviews.Content: My co-workers and I booked 3 rooms for 8 nights. On day 4 we were informed that our reservations were not valid and had to come from the office at lunch to pack our rooms. They were able to accommodate us in ONE room plus my wife that came to visit for our anniversary. 3 men 1 woman in ONE queen bed? You've got to be kidding me! If they would have clued us into their overbooking issues earlier we would have been able to find other lodging. Along with that nonsense, the over all service is terrible. Condescension is the bread and butter of the staff. It is like pulling teeth to even get a clean towel, coffee isn't available, no laundry in the hotel (only send out service at $6 per shirt), staff members seem to just aimlessly roam the halls and crowd the elevators to the point of having to wait several rounds for one. The rooms are pleasant enough, but VERY tiny and apparently not very clean. Two of my pillows had dried blood on them. There must have been other folks who have had as much of a hard time as us. Fire alarms were pulled as a joke at 2 am. That also was handled with absolutely NO professionalism whatever. DO NOT waste your time, money or patience on Club Quarters. Please tell you friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Comfy and Clean. "”
Reviews.Author: travel_chiq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Quarters Boston for 3 nights in June 2011. The hotel is well located right in downtown Boston, practically on the Freedom Trail and walking distance to lots of restaurants, shopping and sight seeing. Room was clean and equipped with the standard hotel amenities (basic bath toiletries, coffee maker). Flat screen TV (lots of channels), comfy bed and bedding, nice shower. My room had no mini-bar. No stationary. Free wireless internet connection was good. This hotel has complimentary filtered water dispensed from a machine in the hallway. You fill your own sterilized bottles that they provide. The halls are quite narrow. And rooms were quite close to each other down small corridors that split off the main hallway. Noisy neighbors could be a problem. The lobby has a nice express check in/out kiosk setup. The guest common area has comfy seats, business computer station to print, complimentary coffee. Outside street is extremely narrow, if its a busy day there's sometimes nowhere to stop. The hotel can give discount to use a close by garage for parking. There's a pub connected to the lobby. It gets noisy at night esp when Karaoke is on Saturday nights. I found the service by the lobby staff and housekeeping to be friendly and helpful. Overall it was a great stay for me. Location was the biggest plus! Central downtown, LOTs of pubs to choose from. Right on the Freedom Trail. Close to the waterfront. Not far from the airport. As far as other hotels in the area go, I think Club Quarters Boston was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Convienent”
Reviews.Author: Rick21234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights for a little vacation time. The small room was not a bother for us, and found it cosy. You are walking distance to the freedom trail as well as the North End resturants. The subway (T) is two blocks away. One minor problem was the king bed is really two singles pushed together. This was not a problem, but the queen sheets did not fit across the bed and was annoying. Come on guys, don't wreck a nice hotel by cheaping out on the sheets. Very good resturant and bar on the lobby level

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: WheatenMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed Fri- Sun, for my first trip to Boston. This is a great hotel that is centrally located. Most of the staff were good. The guys were great but the ladies that work there were kinda snobby, but niceish non the less. The rooms were clean and the water dispenser with bottles was great! My room had a fridge, sink and desk along with a double bed and a pull out couch. It was about a $25 cab ride from the airport, but there is a T stop right up the block if you need. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “So central for sightseeing & shopping”
Reviews.Author: Eve567
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights found this hotel very central, the staff on the front desk were alway's helpful, our room was very comfortable, had a good meal in the Elephant & Castle next door, we enjoyed our stay so much we are bringing friends over from the U.K next year

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacation0923
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters Boston for one night in April because I was in town for a friends birthday. The rooms are very small, but if you plan on being out all night and just need a place to crash it's perfect. It is very close walk to the harbor and Quincy market as well as T-stops. My favorite part was that you can get purified water and bottle it yourself to carry around with you. Overall great and relatively cost effective place to stay for a quick night in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: vtownjake
Reviews.Content: My first trip to this city and this hotel chain. We spent 5 days here - 3 on business and 2 more for touring Boston. My partner and I took a short $7.00 cab ride to the Boston Convention Center each day. Our wives shopped and toured during the day as we were located 1 block from the Freedom Trail - the walking tour of Boston (a must see) and shopping. Pleasant suprise at the hotel - Nice room, comfy king bed and very safe feeling for the wives as we were at meetings during the day. Free bottled water on our floor which we used each day. Mike at the check-in desk was helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. Good Irish pub right next door. Don't miss the Fenway Park tour and the Bleacher Bar or Mike's Pastry. Great stay and great location. Great city to visit with lots of history. Take a trolley tour to get an overview of the city and history.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: nicolecholmes
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with a group of friends to watch a Cubs game in Boston. The range of age was 60 to 28 and every one of us was pretty happy with our experience at Club Quarters. The Good...its location is within walking distance to almost everything in Boston and its also connected to a cute Pub called Elephant and Castle. Service was decent, rooms were clean. The Bad...check in time is 4pm with pretty much no exceptions, you will be charged $35 to get in your room early. The rooms are old offices, so they are small. My boyfriend's feet hung off our tiny bed that was sold as a queen, but made my dorm bed in college look spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for price”
Reviews.Author: Antinmelb
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed especially for someone traveling alone, could be a squeeze for two. Good desk space and very comfortable chair. Not overly fancy but I like that. Great filtered water help yourself with supplied bottles, nice lounge downstairs. Staff helpful and not in your face, Irish pub on ground floor noisy inside but really good cheap food. Biggest downfall for me was thin walls, but didnt prevent me sleeping well. I'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not suitable for more than two”
Reviews.Author: screen66
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The rooms are ok for two but for sure not suitable for a family. The guest sofa was a terrible place to sleep on - after two nights, I knew every spring of the `mattressÂ´ by name. Besides, it was dirty under the sofa. We came with 3 kids (one baby for which we brought a baby bed ). Room service failed to have the guest sofa ready before 20.30 (despite of three requests). Hotel.com previously had promised an extra adjoining room (which has never been available in the entire hotel). Boston si agreat city. For our family, the hotel was a flop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Fernandez
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! It was my second time in Boston but my first time at this beautiful and comfy hotel. The staff is just ok, I still think they should be more friendly because they act like if they were robots, still helfpul staff, they are just doing their work (amazing work by the way) but a smile or a good conversation does not hurt anyone. Rooms are excellent, bed + pillows are A+. Very calm and quite place, after a busy day you always want a good shower and a nice sleep, and this hotel was able to offer me everything I expected for. Great price! You won't find another hotel with such a great price! I would definitely going to stay here again and I am already recommending this hotel to my friends around the World. Loved to stay here. Staff? be more friendly :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: Stayed before in some other CQ and is same style. Typical business hotel, decent-sized rooms (but small bathroom), free wi-fi, confortable, clean, nothing exceptional. Very good location in central Boston. Minus - Very small reception, sometimes pretty busy (I noticed same super small reception/only one person in check counter in other CQ, PLEASE add more people and you create more jobs, ya know, don't save on staff, it is annoying waiting for a long time or having to do the electronic check-in, i go to an easyHotel for that). Anyway staff seemed friendly. - Restaurant/breakfast is in Irish pub in same building. So if you are in the mood of continental breakfast (they just basically have English breakfast), go somewhere else (there are plenty of Starbucks and the alikes in the area). - Bit overpriced (at least when I booked).

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly affordable (for Boston)”
Reviews.Author: Ranke
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel (between trains) mainly because it is an easy walk from South Station; and because of a very attractive $129. rate (most unusual for downtown Boston, and probably available only weekends). I found a nice, compact, European-style hotel, venerable on the outside but everything clean and modern within. No breakfast, of course; and no free wi-fi (only an ethernet connection), but I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: yahooTrave1er
Reviews.Content: We were told that you could get bikes brought to your room to workout. I told the concierge and 2 hours later, I went back down to ask where it was. They said they forgot. I asked for one again. The whole evening went by, went down in the morning and asked where my bike was. They said they could have one to me by that afternoon...what? The bathroom of my room and 1 other colleague had mold it in. The smell was terrible. We spoke with the hotel manager, Chris Davies, who said there's nothing we can do about it. What kind of response is that? We definitely decided not to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly helpfull front desk staff!!”
Reviews.Author: mikeb82
Reviews.Content: What a great hidden gem! the location is amazing and the front desk attendant helped my fiance and I with everything we needed with a smile the whole time. I can't remember how I found Club Quarters hotel in the first place but I am so glad I did and will tell anyone I know who is visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: mimsicle18
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to a club quarters and once again, I was delighted with my choice. the staff is extremely helpful and knowledgable about the area. The hotel is super-clean and just right for a get-away into the City. My favorite part about CQ is the free filtered water with bottles. Most hotels will try and rip you off with having to purchase mini-bar water but not here. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price.”
Reviews.Author: tespes
Reviews.Content: Very clean, adequate room size. I would try to get a room on one of the bottom floors. The bar next door is very convenient. Very nice draft beer selection. Hotel is in walking distance to almost all tourist attractions. Subway 2 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, very nicely done”
Reviews.Author: tobynh
Reviews.Content: This is located right in the middle of Boston's financial district and pretty near Chinatown and the Fanueil Hall marketplace - we walked without any problems. The hotel itself is very well maintained, comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: dominican1976
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay for 1 or 2 nighs in downtown Boston , this is a excellent option , is not expensive , close to everything , confortable , got a bar in the first floor, if you want to have some drinks to start fealing good or to finish the nigth and a restaurant if you dont want to go far to have breakfast or eat something in the mid day . Easy parking , ($ 16.00 /day ) , just 2 blocks away from the hotel .Easy check in and check out . not fancy but looks really good . recomended

Reviews.Title: “Not acceptable”
Reviews.Author: hotel01expert
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, the beds are as hard as concrete, and there was no hot water in the morning. There is not breakfast and no workout room at this hotel. I'm still not sure what I paid for. The hotel manager, Chris Davies, refused to speak with any customers when we approached the front desk. The staff told us to come back later, and when I did, they claimed to be unaware of the issue. There is not meal service; breakfast, room service, or anything related. The hotel recommendation for food was the bar attached to the hotel. Too many things unacceptable with this hotel, please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “great deal in downtown boston”
Reviews.Author: daveshaw2009
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend found this gem on line.....i was skeptical at first....cheap rate....downtown in the financial district for $89.00 a nite? this.....i had to see to believe...... to my shock....it was VERY NICE....a little on the small side but it was great.very neat and clean. there was only a standup shower but it was fine. service was ok and we parked right up the street for a discounted rate of $16.00 per nite.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Aurora330
Reviews.Content: Guest services was rude and not helpful. Rooms are too small, no tub, barely enough room to move around in... Rating of a "D" with the BBB. Restaurant staff was rude and the manager was unprofessional. Price was too high for that area. They took back the $25 dollar voucher they had given us upon arrival the very next day. Hotel staff had no communication with each other or managers to provide us with proper information. I was mandated to stay there as part of a group, otherwise I would have left the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds for a well-rested night of sleep, with a good location”
Reviews.Author: ti89
Reviews.Content: Went to Club Quarters in Boston, enjoyed the location in the Financial District. Just a short walk from the T. The beds are large, offer great quality after a long flight and the room seems to be quite clean. Bath room is a bit small, but suitable for a refreshing shower. Liked the free bottles water in the hall. Overall fine hotel, beautful designed rooms with a (not so special) view on the Financial District streets. Staff is a bit stiff and not extremely friendly: wouldn't expect else from a business hotel. Can also be positively described as "high integrity". Just a suggestion: the breakfast downstairs at the restaurant at the right offers good value and has a good combination of fruits, bread and warm items.

Reviews.Title: “delightfully pleased”
Reviews.Author: lavenderlady089
Reviews.Content: This was our get away after Christmas ( and also the day after the first big snow storm). We chose to travel around on the subway and found the hotel very convenient to alot of things to do. The room was a little small, very clean and handy to have a frig and microwave in the room. There was also bottles of filtered water available down the hall. The staff friendly and helpful. Very reasonable for a hotel in down town Boston. We based our decision to stay here on the reviews we read here and were not disappointed. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, quality room, ideal for hioliday or business traveller”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters in Dec 2010 for a 5 night stay - mainly to watch hockey and basketball at TD Garden. I've spent plenty of time in Bostgon, and aware of location etc. 15 min walk to Garden, ideal for my visit. Very efficent check-in, using a cash machine-type device. (this could be considered a drawback, if you want to ask for specific room/floor). Staff member was on hand to assist if needed. I was on Floor 2, just over entrance to hotel. No problems with noise. Rom was clean and comfortable. Ideal for solo traveller. Good flatscreen tv, shower in bathroom (no bath, maybe an issue for some), cofffee maker was great, and plenty of coffee and creamer, if needed in a cupboard near to ice machine. Great idea. I had to check out fairly early on Sunday morning - no problems whatsoever. The next door 'Elephant and Castle' pub was not as good. The staff were slow and seemed disinterested in servicing customers. I ate there for breakfast one morning - have to say, I'd skip that next time. (Have eaten at other 'Elephant and Castle's' and the menu - to be fair - is good. Computers in lounge for guest use, and free wifi in rooms. Excellent. Overall, great hotel and good value. I reckon it would be fine for couple (and more in the room, and you'd be cramped). I would definately go back to this hotel, when there to watch bruins and celtics.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: nadiarivas
Reviews.Content: The hotel service its superior, the rooms so modern so clean and spotless. The hotel staff so helpful and polite. The wifi worked excellent. We definitely would stay there again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Base”
Reviews.Author: Gezza-K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is described and probably caters for the business traveller more than the leisure tourist, but i have to say found it perfect for a small group of 2 couples. The Hotel is based in the Financial district of Boston, which happens to be a very good base for sightseeing. Boston is a tourists delight with its abundance of historical buildings & monuments. The hotel itself is in very good condition and the staff were excellent. The room we had was very clean and well maintained, my only gripe would be the water pressure was poor from the shower, but as we were only there for 5 days it did not really matter. the hotel has its own pub and restuarant attached to it, this was a popular place with the local business people and although not the cheapest was still reasonable. Travelling down Milk street, you will come across a bar/restuarant called Jose McIntyres, this we found to be a very friendly and good value bar and just around the corner on State street we had a lovely meal and good live music at an irish bar called The Black Rose (Roisin Dubh), in this area there are plenty of bars and restuarants, quite a few with irish themes. To sum up, we are 2 couples in our forties who were on a leisure break, looking to do some sightseeing, shopping (the wives), eating and enjoying a few pints in a friendly atmosphere and i can honestly say we could not have picked a better spot to use as our base. (this was myself and my wife's 4th visit to Boston, in the past we've stayed in the Back Bay area). One last point, i would no recommend hotel as a base if you have children under 16 accompanying you...

Reviews.Title: “nice business hotel - free bottled water”
Reviews.Author: samamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in December. The hotel is clean and efficient with self check in and out. The staff are polite and helpful. There was no breakfast option, but that was fine and the other hotel amenities made up for it. By the lifts on each room level are sealed bottles and a tank of cold filtered water so you can fill up your own water whenever you like. The other big bonus was the super fast free wifi. Beds were comfortable and room was big enough. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian and cold.”
Reviews.Author: Ashbandit
Reviews.Content: No charm whatsoever but if all you're looking for is a bed and a shower you'll have everything you want. Not for folks who like to spend any time in their rooms when awake.

Reviews.Title: “Meh, will not knock your socks off”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyWriter
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this place and came to lightly regret the decision. It wasn't terrible, but I wished i'd just spent a few more dollars to stay somewhere slightly less strange. There was no tub in the bathroom, just a sort of tiled interior with a weird lip to prevent water from going ALL OVER the floor. Walls were scuffed, hallways noisy, toilets loud. In a strange part of Boston and not really worth the money, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - dont expect too much for your money”
Reviews.Author: Osclea
Reviews.Content: The hotel check in was "automated" i.e. check in was via an ATM type machine overseen by hotel staff who were very helpful. The room on first appearance seemed a bit dingy although sunny outside. This was due to the financial district high rise buildings which surrounded it. On the whole the room was smallish with an even smaller bathroom, which wasn't a big deal as we didn't spend much time hanging about the hotel room. The bed was comfortable and of a good size, so no complaints there. If you are looking for a traditional British type kettle for making hot drinks your out of luck, you'll have to do with luke warm coffee or coffee flavoured tea from a coffee maker. The hotel was in a good position, quite near to the centre of town and not to far from the North end "little Italy" area (which is well worth spending some time in if you like food). We found the elephant and castle restaurant which seems to be affiliated to the hotel quite basic. We had steak and found it to be tough and tasteless. On a more positive note the beer was good. On the whole for a hotel in this location in Boston we probably paid the going rate for the type of accommodation offered.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. Nice Location.”
Reviews.Author: ivygirl911
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club Quarters for one night with our 6 month old daughter. They provided us with a decent crib and gave us a room with a fridge. If traveling with a young child, I would suggest bringing your own crib sheet though. They just put a bed sheet over the crib mattress. The rooms are fairly small and don't have tubs, but it's to be expected in the city especially given the price. The beds were comfortable and quiet. The location was excellent. Very short walk to Quincy market and other attractions. The hotel is geared toward people traveling for business. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelgal112
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters is ideally located for tourists in Boston. The hotel is only about two blocks from Faneuil Hall and the Quincy Market, about three or four blocks from the aquarium, and about two blocks from the subway. While the rooms are small, they are very comfortable and provide all that is necessary. Bathrooms are also small but quite clean. The desk staff, which some other reviewers apparently found unfriendly, was unfailingly friendly and helpful, and the free bottled water and morning coffee were nice touches. Also helpful for printing boarding passes and for perusing restaurant choices were the guest computers located just off the small lobby. I would avoid eating in the adjacent pub since the food was mediocre at best. The hotel itself, however was quite pleasant and, if juggling the shuttle/subway trip in from the airport seems too bothersome, is only about a $20 taxi fare from Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping and tourism”
Reviews.Author: badass_midget
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Club Quarters junior suite over the Halloween period. The hotel is perfectly located just 5 mins away from the great transport links and shopping / tourist area of Faneuil Hall and downtown crossing and Macy's are located just 2 minutes behind the hotel. The room itself was like a studio. It had a microwave, perculator, fridge and sink. It was big enough and if you were finickey enough you could hear some of the hallway sounds from outside of the room but not enough to disturb you. The staff were amazing. The Elephant and Castle bar / resturant is nice and extremely cheap. Transportation is super cheap too and is within a 2 - 5 min walk of the hotel. For the best shopping go to the Galleria Mall in Cambridge. Its only a short train ride away but all the shop assistants are so nice they can not do enough for you, unlike some of those we encountered in Downtown Crossing. The hotel also provides free wifi throughout the whole hotel and free coffee in the lounge. I'd definately go back to this hotel again purely to its location, which is in the financial disctrict and so is quiet and safe at night and due to the fact its so close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Could not get to sleep in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: srm1977
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a perfect location as it is 5mins from South Station and 5mins from Quincy Market. There is also a pub next door which does good food and beer Check in is via a kind of ATM machine in the lobby. The room was big but the duvet cover was not clean. I think they need to improve on this. Hotel would have got a better review but for 2 things that prevented me from sleeping. 1. The air conditioning unit when turned off still emits a noise. This means if such noises annoy you, you need to bring some earplugs with you. 2. Between the hours of 12-2am the staff seemed to be making up the rooms. We were near the lift so there was noise from the lift opening/closing, doors being slammed, beds moved around. If you are a heavy sleeper then this hotel is for you. If you are not then perhaps pick somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “NO GUARANTEE OF ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: LP50726
Reviews.Content: Yesterday, October 27 all flights from Atlanta were cancelled due to storm, I called several times to the Club Quarter Hotel to give the new arrival time and date and they just charged a night to us and then cancel the reservation because they prefer to give priority to their "members". Now we arrive to Boston, without any hotel reservation. Take this in consideration before making any reservation at this crap member hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heard the Karoke Bar from room 209 past midnight on Saturday”
Reviews.Author: JBB610
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here again, but would request a room much higher up. I think all the rooms down one hallway are right over the Elephant/Castle restaurant next door, which is open until midnight daily. It was bad. The staff was very helpful and the room plenty large enough for my husband and me. The bathroom was tiny but we were just there a weekend so it was not a big deal. I liked the do-it-yourself water bottles - nice that you don't have to pay. We were short on time so ate breakfast at the Elephant Castle - VERY slow and indifferent service and the food was just edible.

Reviews.Title: “Small, small, small...with free water.”
Reviews.Author: jcmztravel
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were traveling to Massachusetts for a friends wedding, in Sturbridge, but neither of us had been to Boston so we wanted to stay in the city.
