After reading tons of reviews I decided Club Quarters was enough 'in' the city with the cheapest rooms (not cheap at all though, almost $300/night but it was a holiday weekend). The concept for this hotel (and I assume all Club Quarters) is a little odd. They sell themselves as a member property for business travelers and apparently also have corporate suites. Overall, I was expecting a bit more. Our room was minuscule, and the bathroom was even smaller with the tiniest shower I've ever seen (no tub). I should have taken a picture of the shower, imagine a 3x3 box cut on the diagonal - try shaving your legs in that! The location was okay. Anything in the downtown area would have been fine. It is in the financial district and as other reviewers have mentioned, if you're there on the weekend then NOTHING is open (except a few 7-11's) but it's only a few blocks walk to the nearest open Starbucks or the waterfront. The hotel doesn't have much staff so everything is sort of self-serve. There is a refillable water bottle station by the elevators and a closet with extras like irons, mending kits, shower caps and so on. Don't expect much service from the staff, they're nice enough but it doesn't seem to be there job to actually serve you. So, the moral is...if it is the cheapest (by far) that you can find in Boston then go for it...but for slightly more it seems as if you can get a luxury hotel room instead. Oh! AND I would never stay here with children, it's much more of an adult hotel and the walls are paper thin. I was woken up plenty of times by people walking down the halls in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Stay in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sadath1810
Reviews.Content: ClubQuarters is a low budget stay option available in downtown Boston. Close to Quincy market, faneul hall and also the boston harbor, this place is a one of the best options if you dont get to stay in oakwood service apartments. rooms are small though but i would always prefer staying in downtown close to faneiul hall and the quincy market coz these are the most happening places in boston. no bed and breakfast available which is a little discomforting but you have a lot of dunkin donuts, and other fast food joints. below the hotel you have the elephant castle pub which serves great beer. my stay was pleasant and have had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Cancel your credit card after staying at a Club Quarters”
Reviews.Author: jacobp84
Reviews.Content: Staff - Aside from the small rooms (which I was warned about), the shortcomings of the downtown Boston Club Quarters is the incompetent staff. As a guest to this hotel, you can request a stationary bike brought to your room. I made the request, was told the bike would be brought up in 30 minutes. After two hours, I revisited the front desk and spoke with the same woman that checked me in. She said she forgot and would have one brought up immediately. I waited another hour that evening, when I finally called the front desk from my room and canceled the request; only to have someone come by in the morning with a stationary bike... Unknown reservations - While reviewing my credit card statements about one week after my stay at the Club Quarters, I saw another charge for a separate stay at the same Club Quarters. When I called to dispute the charge, I followed the standard protocol, leaving my stay information and inquiry with a manager's voice-mail. The message states a hotel representative will respond within 24 hours, the Club Quarters did not respond until I physically showed up to the hotel two weeks later. Contact the Club Quarters in Boston and dial the extension 6 for billing concerns(--). After one week and another night's charge, I contacted the hotel again, with the same results. What I didn't know is that you leave your question with a woman that is, apparently, on permanent vacation. I found this out later when explaining my call to the hotel manager, Chris Davey, who told me "she's out on vacation and has been for a while". This was September 14th, 2010, since then I have been charged with a third $184-reservation fee and still get no response from the staff or hotel manager. Thank you Club Quarters, I now know to cancel my credit card after a stay with your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jkbsytin
Reviews.Content: it was a bit hard to find, good location. reception was not as friendly, rooms clean and nice. the only problem is you can hear everything going on outside. so if your a light sleeper this hotel will not be the one for you

Reviews.Title: “A value for Boston”
Reviews.Author: sdpryde
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. We received exceptional customer service from host(s) & other staff. The room was a little on the small size; but it was very clean and efficient and super modern. It had everything we needed in a hotel room. For Boston, it was a very good price/value. If we didn't know Boston so well, it might be a little difficult to find; but it is a good location to access most of Boston (Orange Line - State St. - is only a 2 minute walk away). In the business center they might try and locate the printer and "printer control device" away from the p.c. so people can work on them separately. If they had a hot tub, we'd have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Free Bottled Water is a Great Idea”
Reviews.Author: lilackit114
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as a sort of treat for ourselves and it had almost lived up to our expectations. It was clean and fairly comfortable. But the rooms and bathrooms were a tad small. We had what I guess was once a whole room they split into 2. We had no neighbors so there was no noise issues. But we could also clearly hear people passing our room. The wireless internet tended to get backed up. And remember to bring a power strip if you need to use more than one outlet. The most available outlets were at the desk but we were not at the desk. Good thing we did not need the clock. The free bottled water was very helpful in the middle of August. But perhaps it was because it was a weekend, but the hall closet of amenities was nearly empty. However a call to room service very quickly solved our pillow problem. (The pillows are not very full and fluffy so most likely you will need more.) We also had a ticking noise in our vent that maintenance couldn't hear but they at least came to look. I also made the change for a double bedded room only a few weeks before our stay and they were accommodating. The immediate area is also very dead on the weekends. (Something that was very odd to someone from the NY area.) But it is only a few blocks from the nearest metro and the downtown area. It was a little hard to find. Luckily we had GPS! I was also a little peeved on how much it cost to park the car for the weekend and there were no rates posted online but it is located downtown so I guess it should be expected. Overall, the staff is decent and the location is very convenient. I wouldn't pay over $100/night again but if there is a better deal, perhaps I would consider it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: galwaygirla
Reviews.Content: On check in we were greeted by some moody staff, and when we went to our room we found that the extra bed that we had booked hadn't been set up. We asked reception if we could get it made up, again staff were very moody, and when we came back to our room the sheets were just left on the sofa bed, towels frayed. Rooms are a little on the snug side but comfortable. Staff weren't very helpful and didn't have much local knowledge

Reviews.Title: “quiet, great location and good price for a nice room.”
Reviews.Author: daisytcam
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 day stay there and i was so happy with my choice. i was able to get the SL1 bus (silverline to south station) for $2.00 on a charlie card (purchased at the terminal bagage claim area) and within 30 mins. i was checking in and getting ready to start my sightseeing. I would suggest you bring your own reuseable water bottle container as the hotel provides purified filtered water on each floor so you can always refill on your way to the elevators. They provide plastic bottles but anything to save the planet right? I found the room quite comfortable and efficient for a business traveler (since that is who it is geared to). I was surprised to not find an iron in the room but the floor has a blue guest services closet where they keep irons and extra pillows & coffee packs. Even though the front desk is manned, check in and check out is electronic via a touch screen. The shower stall has an adjustable height shower head which the taller folks will be happy for and the room does not have any drawer space except for the night stands but there is shelving in the closet. I was able to pay extra for a late check out and was able to spend my last day there sleeping in, having a leisurely breakfast and finishing up some sightseeing before comingback to the room to gather my bags and head out. I was able to walk EVERYWHERE except to the prudential center which i used the "T" for. I came home with money on my charlie card cause i didn't use it as much as i thought i would. They have a shopping area around the corner maybe 2 blocks up and a post office too. H&M, Macy's, Eddie Bauer outlet, and a host of others. the Filene's Basement is located on Newbury Street along with another slew on shops (I got off at the arlington stop by boston commons and walked from there). I walked to the north end for italian, fanueil hall (and quincy market right behind it for more shopping and a huge food court), i also went to long wharf for the aquarium, whale watching etc.) Part of the freedom trail runs along there as well. I did not feel uncomfortable walking the area at night either. the only down side i sound was the quality of the mattress - i expected a higher quality, a bit firmer or a pillow top perhaps but my back didn't hurt in the morning so it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: VXM
Reviews.Content: With only two days in Boston, we were pleased with the central location of Club Quarters. Was a little noisy being close to the ice machine and vending machines, but otherwise happy with the hotel. Easy walking distance to Boston Common, the harbour, LIttle Italy and many of the historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, but practical hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AventureraPuertorra
Reviews.Content: Perfect room for the one night I stayed, but I don't know if I would stay there longer. It's clean and modern, but tiny and the showers are the European style of tiny shower. The ironing boards and irons are in the hallway and it doesn't have room service. It feels lik a high end boarding room. Even the front desk is unusual, with one person standing in what feels like the middle of a hallway. I would recommend it for a solo traveler on a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: AndraMaryland
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters in Boston was a perfect place to stay for a long weekend in Boston! The rooms were very clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was great (minute walk to subway, easy walk to Boston Common & Freedom Trail, quick ride to Fenway)! Our flight arrived around 11 am, and we were at the hotel within an hour (we took the T which was super easy), and even though check-in wasn't until 3, the staff found a room for us within 5 minutes. After reading all of the other reviews on this website, I was afraid the rooms were going to be too small, but I was pleasantly surprised to find the rooms were very spacious and comfortable! It was a perfect room for two on a romantic get-away. The only thing I'd have to say about staying in the financial district on the weekend is that MOST of the restaurants/cafes/bakeries are CLOSED. We found it very hard to find food after 9pm (we're late eaters), so if you're planning on staying during the weekend, I'd recommend doing your research and finding places to eat ahead of time. There is a restaurant next to the hotel that is open and very good, but we didn't want to eat there for every meal. All in all, this was a wonderful hotel, and if we plan another trip to Boston in the future, we will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - All Around”
Reviews.Author: suzyVeroBeach
Reviews.Content: We found CQ very clean, staff very helpful and friendly, great lobby with computer center. Attached was a nice British pub with good food. Great location! Couldn't have asked for anything more. They even gave you free bottles of purified water. The room was small, but very adequate for two. Pleasantly surprised by the price especially compared to the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a couple or traveling solo - not good for a family in one room.”
Reviews.Author: BethNJ
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better. Right at the heart of the action - so close to so much. The hotel is very nice, very clean, and the rooms are very small. Only queen beds or two twins. We had a family of four, so this didn't work so well - but would be great for a couple or traveling solo. The beds are a bit firm...

Reviews.Title: “The accommodations were disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler6660763
Reviews.Content: First, let me say the service was fine, the location was central, and I guess we got what we paid for (on a priceline bid). But, it was still disappointing to be told after I called to confirm two double beds (which the woman okayed happily) that they in fact do not have rooms with double beds AT ALL. Just a very small "suite" with a queen bed and a broken down old sofa bed. AND they wanted to charge us extra when they gave us this "suite"! Seriously, the fabric that holds the bottom of the bed together was ripped almost fully away from the bed, the linen was not fresh, and the first night I was there, a spring fell out of the bottom of the sofa. In short, not comfortable at all. The bathroom (soooo tiny!) had some black mung around the grout edges--not cool. These were my big gripes. I've learned my lesson, though, no more priceline. I think hotels that are not three- and four-star facilities simply say they are, and you get stuck paying for something you thought you were getting away from.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Boston Comfort”
Reviews.Author: riverrunnermo
Reviews.Content: We found the Club Quarters to be very comfortable for our stay of 6 days / nights in June. The front desk staff was wonderful with their knowledge of Boston and how to get to the various sites we wanted to visit. Clean, and generally quiet... one issue is not theirs... Boston picks up the trash and does their street sweeping at 0-dark-30 right outside our window (we were up on the fifth floor). Club Quarters felt secure with pass/room key for elevator use, etc. The location was awesome! We found the wharf in 8 blocks (15 minute walk), Boston Common was 6 blocks, Old State House was 4 blocks, and Chinatown was 4 blocks. Fanueil Hall and Quncy Market were 6 blocks. The "T' was 4 to 6 blocks in three directions, so convenient to get to Fenway / Boston Pops / Harvard / JFK, etc. Thanks to Club Quarters, our stay was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Comfortable"”
Reviews.Author: codyford1981
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Clean and Comfortable" Nice little bar hooked on

Reviews.Title: “Very average, but good on a budget”
Reviews.Author: allprima
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night for the NBA Finals - chose it due to it's proximity to the Garden and the price ($199/night). We checked in very late (2am) and were upgraded to a suite since no other rooms were available. The front desk attedant (Mike) was very nice and very accommodating. In terms of the rooms, they were similar to what you'd find in a Holiday Inn or Comfort Inn- very basic but flat screen tv's were a nice touch. The bed could have used another blanket (just had sheet and duvet cover (yuck)) and the bathroom was small and could have been updated. Overall was fine for one night, wouldn't have wanted to stay there longer. (Mind you though I am spoiled and usually stay at 4-5 star hotels wherever I travel). If you are on a budget this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizdublin
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other reviews on trip advisor and we were very happy. Hotel was perfect for all our needs,clean, modern, very good location & greast value. if i had to say something bad i would say that it was a little noisy in the morning. I have already recommended this hotel to friends. Thanks trip advisor reviewers for another great holiday hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, perfect in all senses”
Reviews.Author: picasso72
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel having stayed in other in central Boston, I found the hotel to be perfect for my every need. Location, you are arms length from all the major visiting points, 2 minutes from Downtown Crossing T, resturants close by, everything very well situated. The rooms are geared up for business and leisure visitors, I was both, The free wirefi connection was great, free printing which came in very handy, a quick and secure checking in service, free mineral water and bottles, just those small touches which make everything so nice. The service desk are helpful, polite and very professional, I recommend this hotel to anyone, whether you be a tourist, businessman or just passing through, I am going to make enquiries about membership. GREAT, Many thanks to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “In downtown Boston and 20 minute walk...”
Reviews.Author: muz4now
Reviews.Content: In downtown Boston and 20 minute walk from BCEC (convention center), Club Quarters is a convenient and competitive place to stay. Rooms are functional and the staff is professional to mildly curt. Given the local prices and options --well worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, poor service, taxi ripoff”
Reviews.Author: jczorglub
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly centrally located, next to any interest place in dowtown. I could get good rates (150$ per night for one week), good value, not specially noisy, room size ok (may be slightly small for two). If would not have taken care about service, it would have been the perfect hotel. Some examples: the free wifi doesn'work very well (but use another : ECIGuest, also free, and always ok!), You must ask for soap and shampoo, even if no more is visible in the bathroom.They took some time to find the suitcase you let in the morning before the departure. But the top is the "taxi". When I asked for a taxi for the airport, they directed me to a man with a "neutral" monospace, no sign, no meter. The driver, when asked, told me it was 26$ with toll "the normal taxi price" he said (I paid about 20$ from the airport). Till now, ok. But he loaded three other gentlemen, and asked for the full price at the airport (so 4 times 26$)!!! I refused and paid only 10$. Conclusion: You can go to this ideally situated hotel, but rely only on you for the service!

Reviews.Title: “Pahk the car at Boston CQ!”
Reviews.Author: Manchester1234039
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my fiancee and staff were fantastic, rooms were extremely clean and comfortable and can't help to feel that we had a great location in the city! A wonderful city is complemented by a wonderful hotel and for once it is nice to see a huge chain hotel pay attention to the important bits; customer service and satisfaction. Only disadvantage is that there is no free parking, but hey show me a city which has free overnight parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jumbiebeach
Reviews.Content: The best value for the money in Boston. Check In is fast and efficient, and the location is perfect. Also a very nice pub attached to the hotel. Rooms are on the small side, but, they are very clean and seem to have been recently refurbished. The bed is very comfortable and the room is very very quiet. This is not a full service hotel but, for a great location and a great nights sleep CQ cannot be beat. And Ruth Chris is located in the old Boston City hall just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “UNBEATABLE location and price”
Reviews.Author: doandiocasinos
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the Club Quarters in Boston by chance. I put in an open bid on Priceline to stay in one of a few choice areas of Boston, and Club Quarters in the Financial District accepted my offer. I am not a member of Club Quarters, nor had I heard of them before, but everything on their website looked beautiful and the location seemed like it was pretty good as well. I didnâ€™t realize until the morning I was leaving for Boston that there was a notation on the website for Club Quarters that there were daily parking rates. I suppose that this should come as no surprise to anyone familiar with the Financial District of Boston; there are numerous parking garages but few places have their own parking per-se, and even the metered paring that exists is hard to come by and often for limited time frames. This is something to keep in mind for anyone planning on staying in this hotel or any other in the area. Club Quarters had a discount rate worked out with Icon Parking for a lot about a block or two down the street. The weekday rate when I went (right after Valentineâ€™s Day 2010) was $25 for a 24-hour period on weekdays for self-parking, $32 for valet parking, and $16 for self-park on the weekends (Iâ€™m not sure about valet rates for the weekends, but I assume itâ€™s $7 more than self-park again). There is no in-and-out privilege either, meaning that if you use your car twice in one day, then you pay twice. That said, this discount rate is lower than it would cost to park long-term at many other lots in the area and the â€œno in-and-outâ€� stipulation is not uncommon in the vicinity. When coupled with the fact that the hotel is located just a short walk from many points of interest and all of the major subway lines, hence eliminating the need to drive most places in the area, the parking fees shouldnâ€™t deter anyone from staying here. In fact, the cost of the room and parking daily was still less than I would have paid to stay at a chain hotel with parking on the Massachusetts Bay, which is not close to the subway or public transportation, and from which I would have had to drive to all attractions and then find and pay for parking anyway. You are allowed, whether you self-park or not, to pull into the â€œvalet parking onlyâ€� area outside the hotel to load/unload your car when checking in and out. And on a final note about the parking, no cash changes hands throughout your entire stay between the valets/garage and you; rather, the hotel keeps records of all of the parking and cashes you out through them as you check out, at which point you can pay for the parking separately or include it in your room bill. As for the hotel itself, it is very presentable. The pictures on the website do not quite match up to the place itself in person, but that should not come as a surprise to anyone. All pictures of the rooms online are of master suites, and to be honest, I am not sure if suites the size of those shown online even exist at this particular location. Our â€œstandardâ€� room was fairly small, with a queen-size bed, one chair, a desk, mini-fridge, microwave, wall-mounted flat-screen TV, and a small closet. The bathroom was well-mirrored with lots of counter space and a stall shower (not a tub). Wi-fi is free in all rooms, and there are also computers with printers available in the â€œClub Room,â€� a lounge on the main floor. Room service is available not only from the hotel restaurant (Elephant & Castle), but from a few other restaurants of various genres whose full menus are listed in an in-room directory at regular prices (not the inflated room service prices many of us are used to seeing). Oddly absent were an iron and ironing board, but those are available on request, as well as extra amenities such as additional linens, pillows or even in-room delivery of a stationary bicycle or elliptical machine if you choose not to visit the exercise room. Everything, from the rooms to the halls to the lounge, was exceptionally clean and modern. The most important factor to discuss when mentioning this hotel, however, is LOCATION. I honestly could not have asked for a better spot in the city. The hotel is a 2-minute walk to the Orange and Blue subway lines at State Street station, or about 5 minutes from the Green subway line at Haymarket or Government Center stations. The MBTA, the public transportation system in Boston, is among the cleanest, most efficient, user-friendly and convenient subway systems I have ever used. The lines all have stops directly in front of major destinations such as the Museum of Fine Arts, Museum of Science, Quincy Market, the Theater District, Chinatown, the New England Aquarium, the Prudential Center, the JFK Museum, etc. The trains run every 6-8 minutes and make it very easy to get to any destination. Boston is, however, a walking city, and this hotel is an 6-minute walk to Quincy Market, 8 minutes to the Aquarium, 12 minutes to Copley Square, 18 to the Prudential Center, and the list goes on and on. During my week-long stay, I didnâ€™t need to use my car at any point and never ran out of things to do. The location is simply unbeatable for any tourist who wants to hit all of the major attractions of Boston, and I imagine that it would also be perfect for those on business as it is directly in the heart of the government/financial area. I have always been of the mind that, when I am on vacation, I just need a clean room and comfortable amenities, since I donâ€™t plan to spend a majority of my time in the room anyway. As such, Club Quarters was perfectly suited to my needs. I can imagine that for someone in town long-term or someone who desired a spacious room, this might not be sufficient. I cannot speak for the size of the suites, so I would advise anyone concerned about space to call and inquire about the dimensions of the rooms. I would recommend this spot to anyone, and in fact I have already convinced my sisters to spend a weekend there only a week after I left. I plan to use this hotel for all of my future trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and valye”
Reviews.Author: Abs140
Reviews.Content: Smart little business hotel in an incredibly convenient location, minutes away from most of downtown Boston. Friendly service, lots of nice touches (nice lounge with computers, wifi throughout, bottled water for free). The room was tastefully designed and impecably clean. Wonderful place, and great value for central Boston. Well done Club Quarters!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reccomended by a friend and i thank him a lot this information. A very good hotel, with fantastic location, (close to everything in the city) with very good staff and great rooms. We only miss the elephant bar, but everything else was superb. I really reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cost-effective business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mirinae
Reviews.Content: I slept 3 night in this hotel for conference participation. The room was very clean and fit for solo business traveler. The reception was kind. Their free-wireless internet service was attractive and gave much help for my work during my stay. Their location was also good for using metro(State st.): just go out the door and go straight ahead along the street about 2 blocks because it is the very Devonshire street! I got satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “You Get the Location, not the Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: jeyno
Reviews.Content: I booked and pre-paid for a king-bedded double room, arrived after midnight after a flight across the country to find the hotel was covered in scaffolding outside all bedroom windows and the room we were assigned was right opposite the elevators. Asked for a room change and was given the only other room - a tiny twin bedded room. The man that checked me in was polite and efficient but charmless. The girl on the hotel front desk was abrupt and indifferent to the needs of hotel guests. No hotel room service food is available overnight. Breakfast was not included. The hotel is conveniently located for Quincy's Market and Fanueil Hall, a short walk to the Italian quarter and waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient, but cramped.”
Reviews.Author: MikeMorton
Reviews.Content: Just two nights at a conference with very little time at the hotel, but it was OK. Rooms very small (you canâ€™t open the bathroom and closet doors at the same time). Reasonably quiet for a city hotel. Comfy bed. Not enough towels when we checked in; they fixed that immediately. Wireless worked reasonably well. Purified water dispenser is nice. Staff were polite and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value and location”
Reviews.Author: MJWO
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a few days' stay. Check-in was a breeze. The hotel is located w/in easy walking distance of Quincy Market, the State House and other touristy sights. Staff was quite accommodating and helpful. I even enjoyed the Elephant Bar adjacent. The room was large enough for me - might have been tight for 2 or w/ a kid. Check out this value - least expensive of all in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Horrible, unfriendly, and plain sad fron desk.”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice hotel for a business traveler or someone looking to save a few bucks over a nicer hotel. The room was cheap and EVERY day we were there they had upgrades for 15 bucks to a suite with kitchenette. I would wait until you arrive and do this to save a lot of money. I would say the hotel is well worth your money but the staff was HORRIBLE and makes paying the extra 50 a night to go to a nicer hotel well worth it. We had three family members staying here and all of them basically said "wow guy/girl (all of them) at the counter were mad, they must not pay well here". That is basically the vibe you get, that these people desperately hate their job and smiling or calling a cab is a monumental life task. Here are a few examples 1. Asked for a cab and waited 15 minutes, girlfriend went in and asked again and I saw the girl roll her eyes hugely and noticeably from 10 feet behind my girlfriends back, no big deal but seriously over a cab call? 2. One day there was a cab out front and a "house vehicle" I asked twice if the house vehicle was standard taxi rates so i jump into this old beat up Lincoln and off I go. its the third time I have gone from the club quarters to another hotel that week and have paid 8-9 and 11 dollars depending on traffic. When we arrive the guy says "well how does 25 sound" I felt like I got totally ripped off and we negotiated the price down. I said it was BS and this was a 9 buck taxi ride to which he said "this inst a taxi" I had ASKED the front desk and the driver if standard Boston taxi rates applied to the vehicle. Pretty crappy. 3. The club quarters computers don't work what so ever. Anytime I opened a browser I was greeted with pop ups about viruses and "how to date a cougar" websites. I wouldn't trust these computers with any sensitive information. Overall a 3 star hotel with a 1 star staff, really hate to rip staff if you look at my other reviews I am a pretty easy going leisure traveler but this was over the top. I moved to the Hyatt and boy was it worth it. I also noticed the dislike of the CQ front counter staff transcended age, race, and gender so they hit the trifecta. If you dislike your job as much as you appear, please quit I hated seeing people so broken spirited and angry.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: ElissaLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club Quarters for three nights. We got a great price, under $200 a night using Hotwire. The room was simple, quiet and smartly designed for being so small...they used space well. They have a really cool feature in the hallway where they provide empty 8oz water bottles with lids and a purified water dispenser, so you have water at all times! The rooms come with microwave and refrigerator. Free and easy to connect to WiFi. Very basic front desk...you check-in and out at something that looks like an ATM machine. The staff that is there is friendly and helpful with reservations or recommendations when asked. They don't have room service, but they have local restaurant menus in the room to order from. A few drawbacks, shower is small...just a stall, no tub. 2 people in the bathroom at once have a hard time negotiating the small space, and there's a fight for the mirrors. There is a mirror on the door, and a long mirror on the wall by the room door to compensate. The cups and glasses inside the room were a little dusty. The 2nd day we wanted new towels, and came back to the room to only one new towel. When we called downstairs for more towels, they brought up towels and said, "They just came out of the package, they haven't been washed"...and they really smelled like chemicals. The location is great for sight-seeing and walking to Fanueill Hall, The North End and the waterfront. It's also really close to the blue & orange T-Line stop. The one major drawback was finding a decent breakfast. The hotel is in the financial district, so most of the restaurants are closed on weekend mornings. We resorted to eating at Quincy Hall one morning, and Starbucks another morning. If you like donuts and coffee, there is a Dunkin' Donuts and Starbucks every two blocks. For dinner, we walked to the North End, and to the Long Pier in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Boston”
Reviews.Author: millsoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. It is very quaint with smaller rooms, but, I think that to be is expected in the boston area. I had never visited boston and fell in love with the city. Club Quarters was in a good location for walking or cabbing to local sites and restaurants. We LOVED the water bottle system that they had set up on each floor. Very Handy.

Reviews.Title: “You can not go wrong here. Best for couples or if you are single.”
Reviews.Author: vikingbb
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is not a place for families. My wife and I went on this trip without our children so this hotel worked out perfectly. We had an early flight in to Boston so we arrived at the hotel @10:30am. Check in was as easy as I have every had. With reservations already made we used the self serve check in had had our door keycards and were on the elevator within 4 minutes of walking in the door. Our first room was small. I heard some international guests describe the rooms as very European in style and size. While the size of the room was a little suprising it was just the two of us and we were not planning on spending hours upon hours in our room so it was no big deal. It had a bed, bathroom, TV clock radio what else do you have to have? We were checked in with our bags in our room and ready to walk out the door and head to the sights within a half hour of arriving. On our way out the door I stopped and asked the gentleman at the desk if they had bigger rooms to upgrade to. He looked and offered us a "suite" for $20 more a day. If this is offered to you TAKE IT. We went from a very basic room to a room with a mini kitched equipped with everything from a stove top, microwave and fridge to place settings and silverware! After moving our belongings to the new room we were back out the door to start our walk. This is where we found the hidden gem of this hotel. It is ridiculously close to everything. We were a 4 minute walk from Quincy Market in one direction and 4 minutes from the heart of downtown in the other direction. I think it took us 15 minute or less walking time to be at the aquarium and harbor area! You pass "T" stops in either direction if you are trying to get to someplace else. With so many places to eat you could gain weight stopping to eat on your way to whatever it is you want to see. The hotel staff was so helpful we couldn't have asked for more. When I called to get a phone number to a taxi service (we were going out for a fancy dinner) they told me to just call down 5 minutes before we wanted to leave and they would take care of it. When we arrived in the lobby we found a Lincoln Navagator and driver waiting for us. Once we were done eating and checking out some sights we called the hotel and they sent the car back for us. No price gouging here and I really believe it was right on target for what a cab would have cost. This service was also available to us when we left for the airport to fly home. All in all this was a perfect experience. Again I would like to point out this really isn't a hotel for families with small children. It is a no frills hotel for adults who don't expect to spend hours upon hours in their rooms. If you are there for buisness or to see the sights you couldn't do any better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Inmigrante
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights and would recommend Club Quarters Boston to anyone. It is advertised as a "club" hotel i.e. there are no porter or concierge services; however, the receptionist on duty was at all times helpful and check-in was quick and efficient. Our superior room with kitchen area was large, clean and comfortable. We ate in the immediately adjacent Elephant and Castle English style "pub" on three occasions: the pub grub was of a high standard and the service was friendly yet professional. The location, close to the Freedom Trail, was ideal for our vist to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Club Quarters”
Reviews.Author: jackymoff
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and had great service. The first room we went in was a little small, the bed, even though it was a queen it looked and felt like a double. we just called down and they sent up a key with a new room at no extra charge. We ended up getting a king. another great thing was that our flights arrived at 8 and the room was ready to check in. They didn't charge us extra for either of the conviences. clean rooms, only had a shower in our bathroom, and it was small for my boyfriend who is a taller bigger guy. all in all it was a great experience. make sure when you stay there you go up to School St and go to burggers bagel. best bread in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Theo55
Reviews.Content: I would reccomend upgrading to a suite for the $20 night, nice size room with a fridge, Microwave and breakfast bar. 2 TV's, desk. Bed was OK. Near Quincy Market and the T

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Tetracapsula
Reviews.Content: The Cub Quarters is a well positioned, clean and comfy hotel. I stayed in a single room and perhaps it was on the small side in comparison to other places I've stayed it certainly wasn't a problem. The room was incredibly clean and comfortable and I felt like the first person to stay there, the carpets are thick and unworn even in the corridor, the bed firm and very comfortable and the entire room and bathroom spotlessly clean. Free bottled water was a really good touch and good to slip in my bag on the way out touristing. I have to admit I found the check in process and reception staff a bit odd, I think the Club Quarters is attempting to look like a home from home therefore there's no need for staff, I personally am not a fan of big reception/concierge and the hassles that can go with it, so was relieved this was not a feature, but the lost soul standing at the desk as you come and go is a little unnerving. All in all perfect for my short stay in Boston, somewhere clean and comfy to crash, I will look out Club Quarters in other cities I was that happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MarkCarroll
Reviews.Content: he hotel was very nice but the unfriendliness of the staff should deserve a prize: The most unfriendly bunch in the world! Would I recommend it? Only if you are sure you don't neet anything from the reception or anyone else working in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kelkris62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the cheapest for its proximity to some of the major attractions in the heart of Boston. This hotel is within walking distance to Quincy Market, the North end, Boston Harbor, and most subway lines. The room we had was average, with limited space and a small bathroom and TV. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. If you are visiting Boston, most time is spent outside the room anyway, so the size of the room was perfect for the amount of time we were actually in it. Also free wireless internet is provided, which is a GREAT thing!! The only complaint is that there is no parking directly in the hotel, you are directed to park in a parking garage on the back side, or around the block. Also, we only stayed for one night, so the car was parked for a total of 25-28 hours and we had to pay $40 (which included the 20% off compensation the hotel offered). Overall it was a good value for the location and the hotel condiions.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters - clean value hotel in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: JKlassic
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in a Club Quarters (the other in Chicago) and we were not disappointed. CQ hotels are often much cheaper than other area hotels, and although members have first preference, reservations are often open to the public. As was our previous CQ experience in Chicago, rooms here are small and geared towards business travelers with not much but a bed, a desk, a small wall-mounted lcd tv, and a bathroom. I especially appreciated the desk where I could plug in my netbook and other electronics. Yes, there is free wireless Internet here and the speed seemed pretty good. As a guy, I especially appreciated the dark woods and plaids used in the decor. There is a filtered water machine on each floor, and I think they will provide bottles at the front desk. The location is close to several places of interest, although it's definitely in Downtown Boston among several tall buildings (ie. not much of a view from any of the windows here). It's a few short blocks walk from the State T-stop (in the Old State House) to this hotel. Also within a few blocks of several shops at Downtown Crossing, including large Marshall's and TJ Maxx stores. It's also a 15-minute walk to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Marketplace, the New England Aquarium, and the beautiful wharf area. If you're Catholic, be sure to check out the St. Anthony Shrine Church in the neighborhood. We went to Mass there and the music was some of the best "church music" we've heard! Finally, there's a nice Elephant and Castle restaurant connected to the hotel which features British pub-style food. I'm an E&C fan, so this was an added bonus for us. My only complaint would be the long waits for the two slow elevators in the hotel. There were often groups of people waiting in the lobby for a ride upstairs and waits were often several minutes. Also, it's a nice security measure, but the elevator will not move until someone puts their room key in the slot by the elevator buttons. For good value, clean but small rooms, and a location close to several Boston landmarks, you can't go wrong with Club Quarters Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the BAD”
Reviews.Author: Joshblaylock
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Check-in was quick at the hotel. Absolutely no waiting Free water bottles on each floor Nice sized gym facility Bed was extremely confortable Big bathroom Fast and easy wifi Nice tv Great office chair to work in BAD: Moldy old coffee grinds in the coffee maker -YUCK. I read other reviews that had the same problem here. I was really irritated about this as I love making tea before I go to sleep. Mold in bathroom shower Overall m,y stay wasnt horrible but housekeeping needs to stay on top things as it makes a huge difference to a guests stay in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great rooms, comfortable beds, everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: caw954s
Reviews.Content: I'm fussy and I was really happy with club quarters in Boston. There's no doorman, bag service, concierge, free breakfast or valet, instead there's electronic check in (they'll help you), the elevator works when you use your card key, then there's your room. We had two rooms and I asked for twin beds in one and a queen in the other on the same floor and that's just what we got. Very nice comfortable beds, coffee maker, modern furniture, bathroom was just fine. Yes, it had a little mold on the grout in the shower corner...so the maid should use some tilex, but other than that one tiny thing it was a great stay and I'd stay again. Location was perfect, close to the train, Quincy market, freedom trail, big dig, north end, don't hesitate to stay here. Oh, have breakfast at North 26 down by the Quincy market...it's pricey but the best breakfast ever...skip lunch!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Break hotel”
Reviews.Author: LexW
Reviews.Content: Centrally located a few blocks from "State" Blue Line "T" (couple of stops from the airport) this hotel is perfect for a city break. The hotel offers a lounge with free internet stations (as well as free wi fi) as well as TV. The rooms, though on the smaller side of standard American hotels, are boutique style, neat and clean featuring Flat screen TV and modern bathroom facilities. Great location for business (in the heart of the financial district) or for sightseeing. TIP: Lots of coffee shops nearby for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tyclo42
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters is one of the best deals I've found for the traveler who wants to be close to all of the attractions, yet doesn't want to pay an arm and a leg. I seriously don't have a single complaint about this place...the bed was comfortable, wifi was great, and the place was clean as could be. The rooms were a little small, but not crowded by any means. If you want a clean place to stay in Boston for a decent price, then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't want to stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: SumBear
Reviews.Content: Not helpful at the Service Desk The pillow is lumppy (old) and the blanket doesn't feel clean/fresh. The pillow casues both of us neck pain which we usually don't. Soap and shampoo was not avalible and had to go downstairs to ask for it. Positive - They had spring water avalaible at each floor. They hold your luggage for you. But it takes a long time to get them back. Internet was avaliable complimentary. The room was tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam2957
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Club Quarters Boston in June 09 and it was a great hotel. Its situated Downtown near the waterfront/Faneuil Hall and is walking distance to a lot of things. The subway is only a 2 minute walk. We had a large room, bathroom with a shower, very modern and clean. It was quiet too as everything downtown is closed at night and though it has a pub next door, you dont hear a thing. It was extremely reasonable for Boston as I found searching for hotels that everything was so expensive. I think if you are looking for a nice, clean hotel centrally based for not too much Â£Â£ then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CJIMI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in June, 2009. We took Amtrak to Boston, and the hotel was only about a 10 minute walk from South Station. We did not have a car in Boston - the public transportation is very good, and Boston is not a car friendly city. The room was nice, though a bit compact. There is no tub in the bathroom - shower only. I downgraded the hotel a bit, because the grout in the shower did not look too clean. Not quite mouldy - but no where near white, either. If you are not too finicky, you probably will not mind. All in all, not a bad choice for Boston - you probably will not spend too much time in your hotel room, as there is somuch to do in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything, definitely no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: IngaT
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family to check out the beutiful sights of Boston. I didn't spend much time in the hotel, but the time that was spent there was perfect. When we arrived we were greeted by a helpdesk person who helped us check in using te automated service machine. There was no line, no wait- quick and pleasant. The elevators are key-card activated (from your room) so yo know there will be no "outsiders" up in the hotel. Also there's a gym and a vending machine on the second floor (they even have deodorant, so if you happen to forget to take one with you, you can purchase it in the vanding machine :)) Every floor has purified chilled water that you can pour in a provided. The room we had was a small room, with a full size bad, but because we had three people the hotel staff provided us with a second (folding) bad and third set of towels. So even though a room was pretty small, the second bed fit in with no problems, and there was still plenty of room to walk around. Rooms are very couzy, buth they feel more like business then leisure, although the hotel is located in the 'business' district. The lighting in the room was not very bright, but the bethroom light was probably as bright as te sun, so it made up for the brightness. There was a fridge and a microwave, and a hanging closet. Flat screen TV and a desk for the computer or such. The gym is pretty big, there were two tredmills, an eliptical, a bike, and a few more eqipments that I don't use, so I didn't pay much attention to what they were. Oh and the bar next to the hotel, Elephant and Castle. is great. I would not recommend to eat there, but if you have nowhere to be later at night, but you don't wanna go to bad yet, it's a great place to grab a drink. Bartenders are all great there, especially Steve, I think he's the manager, but i'm not sure. They kept us very good company and every drink they made (margharita, mojito and a special martini) was very yummy :) I definiely suggest going there for at least one drink.

Reviews.Title: “choose this one”
Reviews.Author: rouchekoff
Reviews.Content: Very good location just 5 min walk from the historical places, clean room and small kitchen with helpful amenities. The bed base was very good, I slept well. A helpful bottle of chilled water on the room's floor was very much appreciated. Good sevice at desk, nice breakfast in the Elephant. Good value for money unless you are looking for something more luxury. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Goguca
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in Expedia at a very good rate for a Saturday night. Considering the differences in rates with other other hotels in Boston, we thought that this was going to be one of those cheap uninviting hotels. However, this was a top value hotel, offering some interesting feautures that other places will charge you for: free internet in all rooms, free printing from your room, and even they can deliver some gym machines to your room free of charge. The rooms, or at least ours (814) was not particularly huge but it had a very good size with a small flat screen and a clean toilet with power shower (no bath tub). The location is superb, 5 minutes away from the best restaurants, 5 inutes from 2 metro stations, 5 minutes away from teh Aquarium and for those in the business mood, the hotel is right in the centre of the financial district. Taxi to and from the hotel to the airport is 28USD Tip: do the whales watching. The Aquarium company is the best out there. We went on the morning of Saturday 13 June and we watched many whales within a few meters distance.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would go back”
Reviews.Author: Bigsister1
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience during my recent stay. I am not sure what the negative reviews were complaining about. It's not the Ritz (or the Oberoi) but it was so comfortable and inviting, I wanted to move in. The colors are soothing and calming. Everything was clean. Staff was courteous, helpful and most plesant. I had the chance to upgrade from one of the small rooms to a suite. Having a fridge, I was able to shop around the corner and put in a supply of juice and fruit. Though the first room was small, I liked the "coziness" that the suite did not have. The room darkening drapes really did a great job. I am not an English pub fan, but I did enjoy several good meals. Being close to so many subway lines is such a bonus. You can get anywhere via subway with a 2-3 block walk at most, depending on where you want to go and what timeof day it is. Beware subway users: the Devonshire entrance for the State St stop is closed on the weekends, you have to use the main entrance. I was out late for a Sox game one night and out visiting a friend at the end of the orange line another but had no trouble getting back safely. Usual cautions apply. Also, I did not see an elevator or an escalator when I arrived at State St stop on the Blue line from the airport. If there was one, I never saw it. So I opted to take a cab back to the airport because I had a heavy bag. The hotel called a car service rather than a cab so it was a tad more expensive than I anticipated. I shared with another party going to the airport but that did not turn out to save me any money as he charged us both the same for going to 2 different terminals. So beware, get a regular yellow cab and you might do better. If you can lug your luggage, the blue line is the way to go. There is an elevator at the airport stop. Great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: GaerielSky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 1 nite business trip to Newburyport, MA. It's about an hour away, but I wanted to be in Boston. Much better than staying at a Comfort Inn on the road somwhere and for the same price! I'm not a member, but Orbitz had a deal where this was $120 a nite plus tax. Well worth it. Centrally located. Nice accompanyments. Elephant & Castle is right downstairs and does room service too, plus they have other area restaurants menu in the room and they all deliver as well! On Command TV/PPV service in room. I had to ask for iron & board to press my dress for the sales meeting, but they have that and supposedly will even deliver an elliptical or exercise bike to your room for free. Workout room is downstairs. Good water pressure in shower. Comfy bed. And a nice job of having free chilled water with bottles to fill in each hallway. Highly recommend. 33 High Street garage was a breeze, and cost $8 for the night. Hotel validates.

Reviews.Title: “An upgraded motel that needs some minding (and clean bedding)”
Reviews.Author: Westinhan
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters Boston is about a ten minute taxi ride from Logan International Airport. The taxi ride cost us $34, including tips which I thought was way too expensive. All the taxi did was drive through a tunnel and then cross some streets. The hotel is located in the Financial District of Boston and not much is open late at night besides a Seven Eleven. Chinatown is within walking distance as is the harbor which was not very impressive at all. When we went back to the airport, we walked a few blocks to the subway station (which goes straight to the airport though you need to take a free shuttle bus to actually get to the airport). The subway ride was $2. There is a busy pub next door that is connected to the hotel. I'm going to tell you like it is. This is not a hotel. It is like a business motel with clean facilities, but does not provide the right services to serve properly as a business motel. For example, the phone in the room did not have any instructions on how to connect to the front desk or dial outside of the hotel. There is no room service either. I think that's why the word "hotel" is omitted from this establishment's name. From the outside, you can hardly tell it is a hotel as it looks like an apartment building. The room appear clean and looks okay at first sight. But you'll notice the furnishings are kind of a like an upgraded East Coast USA version of IKEA. In other words, it is not luxury or even close to it. The TV hangs above the desk and so you cannot get a straight view from the bed. It does swivel so you can see it better though. The bathroom looks like something that belongs in a low-cost Northern European hotel. There were barely no amenities and the toilet was the same as those found in a public restroom (steel bar for flushing). The shower was dorm room-like with a cheap curtain. I never stay at hotels with bathrooms like this! Maybe when I was a college student backpacking through Europe, but not now! Most upsetting of all was that I could not sleep for even one minute here. The bedding was cheap and rough. I felt itchy all over (bed bugs?) and scratched myself repeatedly on my arms, legs, and neck. I had stayed at hotels just before this and just after this (we were on a long business trip taking us to several different cities) and I did not experience the same situation at other places. I slept quite well in most other places. In addition, something (fire detector?) was making this faint screeching noise all night that I didn't notice during the day when I had the TV on. I wanted to call the front desk, but I couldn't figure out how and I was so tired that I just tried to sleep. I didn't think they'd be able to do anything about it anyhow. I tried and tried to sleep. Of course, I couldn't. Terrible experience. The staff at the desk are young women in their 20s. They are nice, but not professional or experienced hotel staff. In fact, one of them was a trainee. There is usually one staff member at the desk and there does not appear to be a real office. I thought they were nice and tried to be helpful. However, I am used to older, more experienced and professional hotel desk staff. There is no doorman and only an older man who helps with luggage when called. Club Quarters is also overpriced. I have stayed at better hotels for about the same price. SUMMARY: I am really shocked that Club Quarters Boston is rated four stars on certain sites. I want to give this hotel three stars because it looks like a three star, but I just can't because it does not act like one. If it weren't for the nice young lady at the desk was helpful when we were looking for somewhere to eat late at night, I would even consider giving this place one star. I don't think I need to tell you that I will not stay here again. I would rather camp outside in the park if I had no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: LT_Toronto
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about our choice of hotel, especially since I had read some reviews online and they weren't all good, but from the moment that I set foot in the hotel I knew we were going to have a good experience. The guy at the desk was fantastic to deal with and very accommodating. He made us all laugh right when we got there, which was a nice relief from our long drive from Toronto. Right away he got Felix to help us bring our bags upstairs. He was so genuine and helpful, you couldn't help but like him. He also quickly brought us the cot that we requested. The room wasn't huge but it was fine for us. What I liked most was how clean the hotel room and washroom were. Overall I was very impressed and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location, price”
Reviews.Author: snippet_sf
Reviews.Content: I picked Club Quarters for the location and the price. It delivered on both counts. The location was terrific. Just 1.5 blocks from the Old State House/State Street subway station (a breeze to get to from the airport) and 2 blocks from Faneuil Hall. It was within easy walking distance of Beacon Hill, The Boston Commons and the capital building. I couldn't have been more satisfied with the location. The hotel lobby was attractive and the staff at the front desk were nice. There's free internet in the lobby and two stations (never had to wait to use it). In the room there was free wifi. The room was your typical business class room with a professional desk set up and comfortable bed. The plasma TV on the wall had lots of channels, movies, etc. The bathroom was clean and the room was made up to my satisfaction every day (was there for 4 nights). There was no view from the room (just the office building across the street), but I didn't care since it was a place to sleep and nothing more. The was also a dispenser with chilled/filtered water and plastic bottles in the hallway. This was great for drinking water in the room and for taking it with you (which I did every day--nice touch). All told, I was very happy with my stay. It was a good value for the money. I will definitely stay here again next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: Debbie in Maryland
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite hotel! We were in Boston this past weekend for a family vacation and tripadvisor had helped us find this great value. My husband and I and our 11-year old son stayed in a suite with a queen sized bed. There were 2 desks, a full mini kitchen stocked with everything we would need. It was clean, well lit, and comfortable. Great location, nice restaurant, staff was nice. We will definitely look for this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: wizluci
Reviews.Content: I booked knowing the hotel room could be small but it was perfect for a four day stay with two ppl. The location was ideal for walking to attractions and the Commons. Did the Ghost trolly and had a blast. My guide was Mercy Fairweather and she was a ball of laughs. Totally recommend and it was so close to the hotel thru Fannel Hall it was an ideal walk. I recommend the hotel and the restuarant attached. My friend had the fish and chips and i had shepards pie. Both outstanding. Did the 5-wits, warning for kids with chaperons only - over acting but funny. Duck was great and all out Boston and Club Quarters was ideal vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Printmaker
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Club Quarters in Boston and were very pleased with our stay. The rooms are a bit small...reminded us of hotels in Europe, but the space is used efficiently. They are very comfortable and extremely clean. Another nice touch is fresh bottled water supplied free to guests. We used that feature daily.And the location was excellent. We felt like we were in the center of it all.The staff were always helpful and friendly. We also ate at the Elephant and Castle (connected to hotel) and were quite pleased with it as well. We truly enjoyed ourselves and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and close to the action”
Reviews.Author: bouncy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the Club Quarters in Boston in Feb 09 for work and a weekend city-break after. The hotel was very clean and the staff were delightfully friendly - always there to help out or to have a chat with. The room was quite small and fairly dark (dark wallpaper and looking out onto a narrow street with a tall building opposite) but it was clean and tidy and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom is best described as relatively basic, with some updating needed (it could also do with a bath!) but the shower was really hot and powerful and again everything was clean. The hotel was in the financial district, about 5 mins walk from my office, which was perfect. It also meant it was quiet at night and at the weekend as it was a few mins walk from the nearest bar. We found the location perfect for exploring the town - we walked everywhere, even as far as Cambridge! - but its probably be a little bit far for most people to the best restaurants in Back bay; if you're not a fan of walking its minutes from the T stops, and theres a taxi rank just a block away. My tip for your stay - go to Mikes Pastry in the Italian district. Go at about 11pm - its absolutely crazy and the cheesecake is the best I've had in the US!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Theft & Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: GlobalRomanTraveller
Reviews.Content: Don't leave any valuables in the room. I lost cash in an envelope in the room (not a large amount) and the hotel manager responded by defending his staff and doing nothing else. Poor service: usually only one front desk person to check in, check out, be a conceirge, be a switchboard operator and handle all inquiries. So, there is rarely help without a significant wait. And the help don't know much about the inner workings or outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, perfect for business or leisure in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel23
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Club Quarters & right away I could see it was not your typical hotel. Mike at the front desk knew our names from the first moment, and was wonderful our entire stay, we called recently about booking another stay, he is still there, and will no doubt take great care of you as will everyone else here! The rooms are not huge, but unless you are traveling with a lots of kids, I think it serves its purpose. The beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are well equipt with everything you need: T.V., mini fridge, extra cable channels, extra pillows, good shower pressure, clean & tide, etc.Not to mention all the great perks of staying here...bottled water on each floor to take for your day out, tons of maps and info at the front desk, business ceneter has computers with printers, internet, a wide variety of newspapers, coffee & tea, & never seemed over-crowded. The pub next door is great too! Location is no doubt the absolute best at this price, others rooms at nearby spots are twice as much. Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jo_no_anne
Reviews.Content: I really can't see why people have posted nightmare reviews about this place. I LOVED it, and I am uber-picky. First of all, the room is NOT that small unless you're stricken with gigantism. It was very clean, and I have no problem with a standing shower. Who honestly wants to bathe in a hotel tub where dozens of people have already sloshed around? The only complaint I would have would be the lack of irons in each room (there's a community closet on each floor with a few) and that you CAN hear a little bit of sound from the other rooms if people are being loud enough. Other than that, it was dead quiet. The location is beyond amazing. It's just a couple blocks from the State St. T station, which is on the Orange and Blue Lines (straight from the airport!). If you walk around one corner, there's CVS, McDonald's, Wendy's, etc. Walk a few blocks more, and you reach Faneuil Hall. AND there's a door in the lobby that connects the hotel with The Elephant & Castle pub. It was very convenient on those 40 degree days, and the food is pretty good, too. It was nice to have the extra security of an elevator that only worked for people with hotel key cards, and there was always someone staffed at the front desk to say "Hello!" and answer questions. Would I stay there again? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Graet value for maoney”
Reviews.Author: cheersagainone
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff extremely helpful . The room was fine for a two night stay.The loo went wrong on the second day and I was immediately upgraded to a suite.Room for half of Boston.Great location for Quincy Market and China town. Use the tour buses for a graet trip around Boston. Get on and off where you want. Came up from NY by Megabus-its the only way to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: Nollaigaon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Club Quarters had a few reservations about the stay based on all the reviews I was reading. Can't say I'd anything but a great stay. Room could be described as small but very adaquate. Lovely and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful even when I was enquiring about a late check out was accomadated for this. Not sure why people had a bad experience but I can say it was great! Location is fantastic round the corner from the T you can get it straight from the airport. All the great tourist attractions are within walking distance, Markets, Beacon Hill and not forgetting the shopping. Pub associated with the Hotel is great value for evening meals Will definately be recommending to other friends for their travels

Reviews.Title: “Hate the attitude from the lady in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: zzyx68
Reviews.Content: Room is kind of clean but small. The bathroom, however, is too small. Location of the hotel is good, I liked the location, only two blocks away from State subway station, a few blocks away from Quincy Market. But the service from the lobby, especially the lady in the early evening was absurd, very unprofessional. Will I return to this hotel, the answer is simply NO. Bad service only drives away customer.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: tamusana
Reviews.Content: I had the worst experience staying in this hotel. First, one of their staff stormed into my room without any notice. No apologies from the management. Then I was woken up at midnight with a fire alarm. Apparently somebody (most likely a disgruntled staff!) accidentally pulled down the alarm knob. Took two hours to restore normality. Then around 4pm another alarm, no explanation for the cause. This hotel is terrible, and hope this review will be helpful to anybody considering staying there in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joylikes2shop
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel.Easily accessed from the airport using public transport.Hotel is approx 150 yards from State Street 'T'. This area is not busy at the weekend due to being in the financial district but always feels very 'safe' somehow. Our rooms were identical on both occassions.Due to the dark furniture,curtains and bedding, and also the small windows, the room initially seemed small, but in reality we thought it was fine.Bathroom very small with only a shower cubical and no bath, but again we found it suffice. I have seen on this site,some people mention about rooms that have a fridge and kitchen area but not all rooms have this. There are 2 'free to use' computers on the ground floor which were always in use when I wanted to use them but I found most people (myself included) only used them for a short time so therefore if you wait around for a while you can normally go on line without having to wait too long. We didn't have much need to talk to the staff, but when we did they were helpful and informative. FREE bottled water on each floor- TIP- ice buckets and ice available to take to your room, from outside the gym area !!! Next door to the hotel (and accessed through an interconnecting door) is a bar/restaurant -Elephant and Castle-breakfasts were ok, but bar snacks and meals in the evening were GREAT-Frozen Margaritas V.GOOD !.. 5 min walk to Fanuiel Hall area bars and restaurants(-we liked Cheers and Big Dicks Last Resort),Shops (Victoria Secret,Abercrombie,American Eagle,Gap etc) Also Bostix discount ticket booth(Sign up online for up to date info-we REALLY enjoyed the BLUE MAN GROUP-hard to describe, but not really for those interested in 'posh' /fancy shows) Also 5 min walk to harbour area(Legal Seafoods,Hard Rock Cafe, and in particular Joes American Bar at the waterfront which we thought was REALLY LOVELY due to location/views/linen table cloths/staffs uniforms and very resonable prices !!!) 4 min walk to 'Downtown crossing' area (Macys,TJ Maxx,Marshals,DSW,Borders etc) 10 mins walk to Boston Common leading to shopping at Newbury Street,Prudential building and the Back Bay area....DONT MISS THE DUCK TOURS...informative and interesting but definitely NOT boring. A REALLY ENTERTAINING experience. Would definitely stay here again (we are an easy going couple in our 40's ,teenage kids left safely at home but WILL bring kids here in the future)

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Club Quarters”
Reviews.Author: BJJJS
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, we were concerned about our choice. There was no reason to be concerned. Our rooms (3) were clean, quiet, tastefully furnished and except for one room having a very small shower area, we had no complaints. I don't know why people complained about the staff. They could not have been more helpful or pleasant, especially Beverly who went out of her way to help us make plans for a day trip to Cape Cod. Coffee and Tea each weekday morning was a nice surprise. They even served cookies one evening while a group was watching TV in the club lounge. The location is great and we liked having a pub adjacent to the hotel. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Certainly worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep”
Reviews.Author: mdrRDU
Reviews.Content: If you stay here be sure to ask for a room that does not have a faulty airconditioner. Mine (503) kept me awake all night. When I reported it to the front desk they told me they knew some rooms have that problem "sorry".

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastRain
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite nice for business travel. Nothing special about the rooms, business center or fitness center but they are functional. The filtered water is a nice touch. All but one of the front desk staff we dealt with were rude. They did not want to help us with directions or booking restaurant reservations. There was one gentleman at the desk who was the exception and we left him a nice tip for being so helpful and kind. I will probably stay at another hotel when I come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: DrBio
Reviews.Content: I needed to spend 3 days mid-week in Boston. To avoid being ripped off by the airlines it is cheaper to buy a hotel + flight than flight alone (or back to back flights as two are cheaper than one). I chose this Hotel as it was convenient for the subway. I had a decent size room with Internet access and a small kitchen area which I never got to use. The location is convenient and central and the attached "British pub" was OK although Bostom is a place of many pubs and the overall standard is good. Staff were friendly enough and it was clean, which is enough for me when on business. The central location would be good for tourists and I'd have no qualms about using this again

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Club Quarters Boston”
Reviews.Author: JodeeNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at Club Quarters Boston. The hotel is in a great location. Yes, the rooms were a bit small however after reading some of the reviews I expected worse. They were clean (and I am very fussy) and the beds were very comfortable. As we had a room at the end of the hall, it was quiet . We did hear the tv from the next room one night so I guess if you had loud neighbors it could be a problem. We found the desk staff to be very helpful - Chris especially. He was friendly and took a lot of time highlighting a map for us and giving helpful tips. I got a very good rate calling the hotel direct - $158 per night. We would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A glorified business dormitory”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters in Boston for two nights early in August 2008. I booked my stay at CQ as a "preferred hotel" for my company through Orbitz for Business, and based my choice on the combination of central location and reasonable rate. In both cases, the CQ is eminently satisfactory. The hotel provides a clean, reasonably comfortable room for about 60% of the price of other hotels on our "preferred" list, and is very central to Boston's Financial district. What you won't find at CQ is anything resembling a frill. Check-in is via a self-service kiosk that didn't work at all (apparently, this is a common event, because the one person who IS at the front desk, concierge-like, hovers by the check-in kiosks to intercept frustrated guests). The lobby is tiny, more like a vestibule -- nicely decorated but cramped. I didn't go into the "club room" off the lobby, but it looked nice enough. You gain access to your room by zipping your room key in the elevator -- a security feature, I suppose, but I don't feel that insecure in hotels, so to me it's just a pain. My room was on the sixth floor, off a narrow hallway the runs through the center of the building (past, as others have noted, a machine that provides chilled and filtered water -- a nice touch). The room itself was small but decently appointed -- somewhat spartan, in the fashion of a mid-seventies college dorm-room that had been gussied up with some designer furniture and finishes -- but you could still see its origins in the narrow room, cheap tile, and bath fixtures. Serviceable, but not cozy or warm. Also -- my room faced Devonshire Street, and was moderately noisy all night. Overall -- a decent value for the money, well situated, and passably comfortable -- but you won't mistake it for the Taj.

Reviews.Title: “best for Monday to Friday business guests”
Reviews.Author: Juicyjuice
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Thurs and Friday nights. The bedding was extremely odd in that the bottom sheets did not make it up to the top of the mattress, so that about 5-6 inches of mattress was visible on both of the beds. The sheets were always loose because of this and because the maid did not tuck them in on the sides. Bathroom not tidied up by the maid.The pillows appeared to have been washed in a machine because they were a mass of lumps. One replacement pillow was available in the guest closet on each floor, but no pillowcase, so no good for that. There was a pillowtop mattress in a plastic case stored under my bed which was large and poked out under the bed on both sides. This hotel has a service for frequent visitors whereby you can leave things in the hotel for future visits. i wonder if this was someone's pillowtop stored under my bed. There is access to computer use in the Club Room off the lobby, but was unavailable to us for three hours on Friday due to a group meeting in there. The free morning coffee in this Club Room is not available on weekends, which is annoying and also insulting, considering that we were told that since the hotel is in the financial district, there are barely any places open on the weekend for breakfast. The adjoining restaurant, only has a $18 buffet available. Nothing else. The purified water on each floor with bottles is innovative and much appreciated. One young man at the desk, was friendly and always asked if we were having a good time and found interesting things to do. Overall, this hotel's management seems to be a little peculiar and fragmented.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Julielesyeuxbleus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club Quarters from July 19 to July 21 and we were very happy with the hotel. The situation of the hotel in Boston is perfect, just a few blocks from Washington Street and 10 minutes from the Faneuil Hall which we had to take the hop on/hop off. The staff was very helpful and polite. The room was small but very clean and very quiet. (we had a room on the 8th floor).
