However, we do not recommend this hotel if you have young children because of the small room and the small elevators!

Reviews.Title: “It had free filtered water.”
Reviews.Author: uoducks1999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Qurters for my cousins wedding. I guess that you do get what you paid for. My brother and I got a room there for 3 nights. It took a while to find the hotel, there is an awning that has the logo and nothing else. You really have to look for it to find the hotel. Not to mention that it is not a lot of fun to drive in downtown Boston. Luckily, we didn't have to drive! The room had 2 twins bed, a small desk, a 19 inch flat panel tv, a chair and a very small bathroom. There was barely enough room for two sets of golf clubs and 2 suitcases. The beds were alright, the sheets were stained and had to be changed (and may not have been changed the entire time we were there). The bed had a sheet and a comforter and no extra blankets. They only gave us 2 towels in the bathroom, so nothing extra to use. We also had our room cards replaced twice because they would never work. The guy at the front desk thought he was better then everyone there and was not the friendliest. The walls are pretty thin. We could hear the chicks in the next room. I am just glad we didn't waste that much money on the hotel. The nice thing was that they had plastice water bottles and free filtered water. That was about the only thing I liked about the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoBos
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Club Quarters right in the heart of Boston. The location was great â€“ close to Fanueil Hall, the Boston Common, the Freedom Trail, several T stations, all kinds of restaurants, etc. I was a bit worried, having read past reviews, but the size of the room was just fine and had plenty of room for the two of us. The bathroom was small but sufficient, had plenty of mirrors and hot water, although the walls could have used a coat of paint. The express check-in machine was a nice idea but it wasn't working properly so it was great to have a staff member available at the desk. The woman who checked us in was very personable. Unfortunately, I can't say the same for some of the other staff members, but all were efficient and knowledgeable. The purified water station in the hall was great but the idea of a guest supply closet is just silly. We actually checked it several times each day for extra pillows and/or towels but found it empty every time. (Why not just have the extras in the room already?) Along the same lines, if you choose not to have your linens changed daily, remember that you'll probably run out of such things as shampoo and toilet paper! If you get one of the â€“01 rooms (801, 901, etc.), I suggest you ask for a different room. These rooms are literally right off the elevators and you'll hear the foot traffic. It seems that even the most polite hotel guests will tend to talk loudly while waiting for the elevators, at all hours of the day or night, not realizing there's a guest room right there. A word of warning â€“ whatever you do, do not try to take the stairs to another floor or down to the lobby. Once you're in the stairwell, the door will lock behind you and you will have to walk all the way down, out onto the street and back in through the front door of the hotel. It's an interesting trip if you're wearing only pajamas and wooly socks. The Elephant and Castle restaurant next door to the hotel is a bit expensive but the food, while nothing fancy, is not bad. It's obviously very popular, always crowded and you can charge your dinner to your hotel room. It's a great place to have a nightcap before heading up to bed. While our stay at the Club Quarters was nice enough, I'm not sure we'll hurry back. If you're planning to see Boston, take tours, see shows or go out for dinners and all you need is a roof over your head and a pillow under it, this hotel will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay at a good price”
Reviews.Author: CW22
Reviews.Content: Generally I think it's a good place to stay for a reasonable price. I paid $122 through hotels.com for a Sunday night traveling on business, and stayed on floor 10. The room is small but OK for 1 night. Everything worked, bed was comfy, room was fairly quiet, even the heat/AC. Great location if you need downtown Boston. One thing I didn't like was the teeny stand up shower. Once you make room for the shower curtain that keeps seeking out your wet skin (instead of a sliding door) you have very little room to shower. Then there was water all over the floor when I got done. The other thing that bugged me was the check in/check out process. They have a kiosk near the front desk which they mandate you use, either with or without their help. Upon arrival it was like 'hi there. . . go use the machine.' Not much of a welcome. But generally I thought it was a good room at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, small room, bad bed”
Reviews.Author: schneiks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on May 15-19. I had no complaints about the staff - they were attentive and helpful. The pub next door had food/drink at reasonable prices for the area and also delivered to your room at no extra charge (although they automatically add tip 18%). The location of this hotel is about 2 blocks off the beaten path but your are just a couple blocks from Washington St. shopping, Quincy Market and a couple T stations. If you can walk a couple blocks to save some money this is the place for you. My two complaints are the size of the rooms - very small - and the size of my bed. I was in a room that had two twin beds and it was like sleeping on cement - cement too short for my 6'1" frame. My feet hung off the end of the bed. One thing that was really nice was the free purified water filling station on each floor - with all the walking we did it was nice to have bottled water at our disposal.

Reviews.Title: “Overally satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: mawie49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club Quarters Boston from April 25th to April 27th 2008. We arrived in Boston at 6:30 in the morning of the 26th. We went directly to the hotel because we wanted to leave our luggages there until check-in time - but surprisingly, the room was already available ! It was a very appreciated opportunity since we had just made an exhausting 7 hour bus ride. Otherwise, two things could have been better : the staff and the noise. The staff isn't the friendliest in the world. I don't have any souvenir of a smile or anything like that. They do their job - but that's it. As for the noise, we could easily hear conversations in the bathrooms on other floors and in the corridors. But overally, considering the location & daily rate, negative aspects just aren't that important. If you're staying at Club Quarters during the week-end, keep in mind that you'll have to walk a little to get to restaurants and stores. Since the hotel is located in the heart of Financial District, everything nearby is closed on Saturday and Sunday. But Boston being a relatively small city, pretty much everything is in a reasonnable walking distance. The room size was just fine for two people. Although the bathroom could have easily been a little bigger even to the room's lost, if was very comfortable. To my surprise, there was a fridge and microwave in the room, which happened to be very useful in my case. The room was clean and neat. The proximity of the pub is handy - drinks and beer are great and cheap. Food is pretty good but don't bother getting the brunch on mornings - it's $18 per person for not so many choices. They have a breakfast special - two eggs, a huge sausage, potatoes, beans and toasts for $10. The staff is mostly friendly. Overally, I'd say we had a very good experience at Club Quarters. We recommend it for businness travelers or couples. Not really appropriate for people travelling with children. We'll certainly return to one of the many Club Quarters in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay..decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: jfsempre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here for one night, becasue of the great price. We were able to check in early, which was great, and it is very local to everything..able to walk to every attraction. However, we were put on the 2nd floor, and there was wood plywood blocking our entire window. The cleaning staff, was very noisy in the halls, and there was a ton of construction going on. Rooms are very small, the bathroom is extremely tiny! The bed, though is soft and as comfortable as could be! We asked for a taxi to be called, and we were told, they have a long wait, and to walk up the block to the taxi stand. Will not return for a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, just avoid the second floor”
Reviews.Author: tconlan25
Reviews.Content: While this is a business class hotel it does well for the weekend getaway set as well. Rooms are on the small side with a double bed, 19 flat screen TV, and a bathroom with a shower stall only but this fits what most business travelers need. Also it's only a block and a half to the State "T" station making getting around town easy. The room was clean and well appointed, and the self serve bottled water station on each floor was a nice touch The only problem we had had more to do with room location than anything else. Our room, 203, was right above where the live music and karaoke are done on Friday and Saturday nights. I don't mean that the room is on the second floor so it's above the Elephant and Castle bar, I mean the microphones and speakers are RIGHT BELOW the room. If you do get that room you may want to request a different one. Also there was someone running a jackhammer at 730 am on a Sunday, but it's the financial district and buildings are being remodeled all the time. Overall I would recommend it based on price and location, but if you're looking for spacious, luxury digs you may want to look somewhere else .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dove95
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here during Easter weekend, and we loved the location. Really close to the Ts for Downtown Crossing and State Street. Just a few blocks away from Faneuil Hall, and for the prices, it's not bad at all. The rooms are smaller than I'm used to, but it wasn't unbearable. It was actually just fine for two people. The only slight inconvenience was that the ice is only located on the second floor, but there's at least "chilled purified" water on every floor. The hotel was accommodating to our needing more pillows and washcloths, so yay for that. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mwbracken
Reviews.Content: Downtown location, fairly moderate price. However, the staff was most unfriendly, barely courteous. It should be pointed out that English was a second language for the majority of the staff. The attached "pub" served mediocre food & check your bill! Mrs. W. Bracken Penn Valley, CA

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: BLynnS
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at a Club Quartes before, and was slightly wary of the budget accomodations, but needed a place for one night so I took a chance. I was very pleased with my choice. It is located on a side street in an old building very near Faneuil Hall, Quincey Market, and the aquarium. Check in was done by machine (a first for me) but there is someone at the desk 24/7 to help if needed. The lobby was small but nice and there was a large "club room" open to all adjacent to it that was plush and comfortable. The hallways were narrow as is typical in this type of building. My room was smallish (although I have been in much smaller rooms!) , cute, and very well appointed. It was very cleverly designed to make the most of the space and to soundproof the walls of adjoining rooms. Everything (TV, microwave, phone, bed) seemed fairly new. I loved the self serve water bottle bar in the hallway. The next morning I was able to leave my bags for $1/bag while I roamed around. I arrived late in the evening after the kitchen in the adjoining restaurant closed and there were no other nearby restaurants which didn't upset me much but would certainly present a problem for the hungry or those with kids. The wireless wasn't working the night I was there which was a disappointment to me. Some reviewers have commented on the noise but to me it was just big city noise; coming from SF I wasn't bothered. I did occasionally hear a noise from the hallway that I might not have heard in a larger or newer establishment but the price and charm of this hotel far outweighed any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters quite satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Valueguy
Reviews.Content: Two of us (early 60â€™s) stayed one night (Room 708). We thought the accommodations and location just fine - about a fifteen minute walk to the theater district, and less than ten minutes from the Boston Common or the Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market area. (taxis can be called by the desk person.) Self check-in (if the machine works), otherwise, very pleasant assistance. In fact, during our short stay, each of the desk personnel was kind and helpful. The room was clean and basic, with a shower (no bathtub). We found the size of the room just fine; the â€œqueenâ€� bed seemed a little small (but I hadnâ€™t brought a ruler to check.) There was a work desk and chair, and a more comfortable â€œwork styleâ€� upholstered chair, as well. There was a coffee/tea machine, too. Although the lobby itself is small, there is a â€œclub room" attached with attractive furnishings, a gas fireplace, and two â€œfreeâ€� internet-accessible computers. In the afternoon of this weekend day, cookies were set out. The attached/associated restaurant, The Elephant and Castle, as the name suggests, was decorated as an English pub, with several TV sets (tuned to English football while we were there). We had a lunch there, choosing from the â€œPub fareâ€� menu, and enjoyed the food. Curiously, we thought that the prices were just what we would have paid in London, in dollars. If your goal is to be out and about downtown Boston, why pay more for a fancier room? Weâ€™ll check this out next time, too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: _kmz_aw_
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday on a budget, and being students didn't expect too much for the low price we paid overall. However, having been to Boston before, I was pleasantly surprised when the taxi pulled up outside the Club Quarters, what with it's ideal location in the city. When we walked into the lobby we were greeted by the receptionist who kindly upgraded us to a room with a fridge and microwave. Inside the room, it was spacious with a nice decor, and the bed was very comfortable with feather pillows and a down duvet (we did help ourselves to two extra pillows from the guest request closest). The bathroom was small but did the job. I have terrible eyesight so I found the extendable and magnifying mirror that was attached to the wall very handy when I was putting on my make-up. The club room with internet access was incredibly useful, though we could also access the wi-fi in our room too. We had breakfast in the pub/restaurant next door to the hotel one morning, but didn't particularly like it so didn't bother to go there again. Housekeeping came everyday and we found it very efficient. On the last day, we paid $30 to check-out at 3pm as we had a late flight home. We thought this was reasonable as it meant we could make the most of our last morning in Boston. All in all, we would definitely stay in Club Quarters again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Location - Location”
Reviews.Author: fego
Reviews.Content: PROS: 2 minute walk from Downtown Crossing. Free internet access. Rooms clean and comfortable. Staff friendly and efficient. Seperate pub & restaurant on site - "The Elephant & Castle". CONS: Bathroom tiny. No sound proofing between rooms, it is possible to hear the television in the room next door. The attached pub / restaurant is extremely busy and crowded with after work socialisers. OVERALL: A good experience and for the price, we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok!”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Me
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week in November. It's clean and basic and we thought it was worth the money we paid (we got a GREAT deal). On checkin, they just took the credit card, then gave us a room keycard - didn't show us where the lift was, didn't tell us our room number - just said "next please". The reception staff seemed to be put out if we asked them for directions or had general queries etc. so we had trouble that way trying to plan our day because we had no help from them. The location is good, you're right in the financial district, about a five minute walk to downtown crossing and fanueil hall.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs to get thru it”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool01
Reviews.Content: I just spent the last 2 nights at this hotel. You can hear every person walking down the hall and even hear the TV in the room next to you. People would come in at midnight and 2am talking like they were in the same room with me. There is absolutely NO insulation between walls or doors in these rooms. The rooms are absolutely tiny. You feel like you are staying in a dorm room. Not to mention, the staff is rude and make you feel like you are bothering them asking for directions. Don't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2585
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from Club Quarters because I paid so little compared to other area hotels. Well, I ended up pleasantly surprised! I booked this hotel for one night because it was so close to TD Banknorth Garden. Upon arrival I used the self-check-in kiosk and it was quite fast. I hopped on the elevator and was a little confused at first... you have to first slide your room key and then choose your floor. When you get off the elevator there is free bottled water to your right, very nice touch. We stayed on the 9th floor in a street facing room. The room was small, but for two people we didn't need a ton of space. The bed had clean linens and was quite comfy. The bathroom was clean and offered soap, shampoo and mouthwash. The shower was very tiny, our bathroom got a little flooded because the curtain was so small. The room also had a flatscreen tv. I loved how quiet this hotel was! Often when I stay in hotels I am woken up by the other guests because of thin walls or by room service. However, we were able to sleep late and never heard another person in the hotel. Also, check out is 12 which is considerably later than a lot of the other hotels in downtown. I would definitely stay here again! It was a pleasant stay and great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meatloafmom
Reviews.Content: We purchased a night at the Club Quarters thru Priceline and we were not sure what to expect after reading the reviews of how small and other negative comments. We arrived on Friday November 2nd at 11:15 AM and we were pleasantly surprised to find our room was ready. The room was equipped with fridge, microwave and sink. The bathroom was small but suited us just fine. We walked to Quincy Market(5 minute walk) and to the theatre district, 10 minute walk and the shopping on Washington Street was a block away, everything was nicely located. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: fergusonjjec
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here and was a little skeptical given the competitive price....first stay at a club quarters and based on this stay i'd do it again. I'm widely travelled and have stayed at many a very very nice hotel. This hotel was in a great location, clean and relatively quiet. No view for me whatsoever...but I was looking for a business place to stay that was convenient and reasonable and within walking distance to the convention center (25 min one way)...,net net i'd stay here again...it was all good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: winter_turtle
Reviews.Content: VERY VERY small room. Reminds me of a single dorm room back in college. However, it was very clean and new. My room overlooked Devonshire on the 2nd floor. I wish the windows had reflecting film so people could not see in from the building opposite. Wireless internet was bad from my room. Barely made connections. Good thing was a delivery menu available. It was great for when I came back to the room tired. No parking. Parking is on Arch Street and is very expensive. Great location. I walked to Fanueil Hall and Prudential Center. The old state house was just a stone throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, esp for tourists”
Reviews.Author: alankk
Reviews.Content: Room was small, but as expected for a downtown hotel and quite comfortable. Most Boston tourist attractions (and a couple of T stations) are a short walk away and airport access is a breeze. Facilities are not lavish, but provided what was needed. I can fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not 'luxury'.”
Reviews.Author: OuttaHere1953
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for walking. The financial area goes 'dead' after quitting time so you'll have to walk over to Fanueil Square for any action or restaurants. Only about a ten minute walk. Location is good. Cleanliness was okay. Don't expect anything resembling a great, luxurious experience. It's more like a nice dorm. If you want romantic and impressive, go elsewhere, but this is certainly adequate for business travelers or vacationers who just want a nice, clean place to stay. Service was good and friendly. when I asked for a roll away bed in the morning, it was there in the room when I came back from my day's activities. Again, don't expect luxury, but it was cheaper than some hotels and it was easy to get places. Close walk to subways, South Station etc. You can walk to the North End for Italian dinners. Weekends are packed. Get to a restaurant early because by 8pm you'll have at least an hour or hour and a half wait to get in anywhere. If you're traveling by yourself or with one other person, this could work. As long as you're not expecting marble tiled bathrooms with separate dressing area and 42" plasma screen tvs. And the pillows were sort of "iffy". Like a pile of foam pieces stuffed inside a bag. Still.... okay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but Housekeeping Could Improve”
Reviews.Author: ArielChicago
Reviews.Content: My room was fairly small but adequate and the bed was comfortable. I was very close to the elevator but fortunately the other guests were considerate. The club room, with computers for guest use, was a nice touch. My main concern was the poor housekeeping. Although the room was clean enough, it was clear that the housekeeping staff did very little to provide for the guests. When I arrived, I found a tiny tube of shampoo and a little bottle of mouthwash. Once they were gone, they were never replaced despite my request to the front desk. A sign on the bed says the sheets are changed every other day but mine were not changed during a 5 day stay. Although towels are supposed to changed every other day, mine were changed only if I placed them on the floor of the shower. The day I did this, I received two bath mats but no hand towel or washcloth. Coffee making supplies are minimal and not always refilled. To get more, you have to go to a closet on the floor. This hotel would be fine for a night or two but it became rather tiresome after a full week. It is woefully understaffed and this shows up in the level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: detroitish
Reviews.Content: We loved the Club Quarters in Boston! It suited our needs perfectly. The location was great. The accomodations were comfortable and clean. Those were our top priorities and they were met. The hotel was a a clean & safe place to sleep while we were in Boston. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for honeymooners or families looking to spend a lot of their stay in the room. It is just not that kind of place. Things to know about Club Quarters: 1. the rooms are small - but comfortable for 1-2 people 2. they are catering to the business traveller, that is why it is located in the Financial District 3. this is not a luxury or boutique hotel - don't expect fancy soaps or over the top customer service If you recognize these things before booking and you are OK with these potential issues, then you will enjoy your stay. One awesome feature was the FREE bottled (cold) water available by the elevators on each floor. Every morning before we headed out to see the sites we would fill up. Also, there are 2 computers in the lobby/lounge with FREE internet access. NICE! I would definitely stay here again. I have stayed at Club Quarters in NYC and Chicago as well and had similar experiences.

Reviews.Title: “A great relief to a long journey.”
Reviews.Author: ancientone001
Reviews.Content: I had flown to Boston from Wellington New Zealand to embark on a cruise from there. The time taken was 17 hours in the air and I was nearing exaustion. ( I am 75)....A welcome arrival, easy registering on a computer, A great room and most of all a bed that was not flying at hundreds of miles an hour. Luggage at Boston Airport was 1 1/2 hours coming off so that just added to my woes, nonethe less my experience was all good and the coffee shop right next door was fabulous. I MUST have been jetlagged as afterwads I could not find my room, I was in 3 19 and looked for 913...Found it soon enough. Lost the rubber tip from my cane but the obliging desk clerk returned to my room and found it under the bed just as the taxi arrived. Altogether a most satisfing stay and I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jkb1516
Reviews.Content: I spent the better part of a year in Boston and once I discovered this hotel it was my preferred lodging. This is a membership hotel (as in, you or your company have to buy a membership to stay here). For the location, rates were very reasonable. Rooms are clean & efficient (some might think small). Flat-screen TV, free wireless internet. Beds are very comfortable. Get a room on the front side if you want to avoid the noise from garbage pickup that you'll hear if you're on the back. Walkable to many points of interest such as Theater District, Boston Commons, Quincy Market, North End. The Old State House is just a couple of blocks away. There is a bar/restaurant (not affiliated with the hotel) with good food, accessible from the hotel lobby and I believe you can order room service from them, but I never did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, helpful staff and amazing beds”
Reviews.Author: tu1angel
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for the Wine Expo and all the hotels near the trade center were either completely booked or ridiculously expensive. After a search online, we decided to give the Club Quarters a chance. We absolutely love the hotel. It was a short walk from the bus terminal. Once we reached the hotel, the front desk was very helpful and check-in was quick. The room was small but the layout of the room provides for max space and felt really cozy. The room was very clean and modern. The bed sheets and the comforters were the best; I had the best sleep ever. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but super tiny!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_to_eat
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston for friend's birthday celebration and this hotel was perfect. Great downtown location, parking, and good value. The room was incredibly small, but beautifully decorated. I plan on returning for all my future Boston trips!

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarter's Boston..Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mdodge645
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Minutes walk from Fanueil Hall and many other attractions. Hotel is a little tricky to find, just look for the Elephant ant Castle Pub which is connected to it. They offer reduced parking 2 blocks away and you can easily cut through the pub to save walking. Rooms were very nice and clean. Shockingly, each floor offers free bottled water.....instead of $4.00 for a liter like most chain hotels. The club room on the first floor offers coffee, tea and has 2 computers (with printers) available at all times. All in all, I couldn't have been happier for the price that I paid. ($80 priceline)

Reviews.Title: “Rent a bed”
Reviews.Author: Meyta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters for 6 days. The service at the front desk is overall poor. Examples of poor delivery during my stay include the following: 1. The room was never dusted. a banana peel sat on the counter for 4 days 2. I was evicted from their only public area/business center which was used as the overflow for their restaurant. This was done without a posted notice and with no regard to basic hospitality practices. Left without a place where to charge my laptop I was forced to conduct a conference call from the nearest Dunkin Donuts. This was done after I had checked out early as a courtesy to the hotel to allow them to prepare rooms during a very busy Friday 3 I left towels in the shower floor to be replaced only to find the same pile and new towels stacked on top of my side chair. 4. I waited in the pub to be acknowledged or sat down for 20 minutes. Nobody even made eye contact with me The hotel does not effectively cater to the business travel. Poorly managed and a shame to the Club Quarters organization

Reviews.Title: “Poor attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: smatz177
Reviews.Content: The place had nice amenities but lacked attention to detail. There was a provided blow dryer and (poor tasting) mouthwash, but no lotion or conditioner. There was mold on the shower curtain. The promised bathrobe was missing. The free internet had such a weak signal that I had to go to the lobby to check email. The place could be nice but it needs better managing.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: redheadLongIsland_Ny
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nites over mother's day weekend. the rooms are very small, but comfortable, clean, and modern. the staff not helpful. we saw parking out on the street and asked advice from the desk. their response was they didn't know anything about it. we wound up getting two tickets, i think the signs were not clear and we couldn't get an answer from the desk , so it wasn't such a bargain after all. also, the area surrounding the hotel is very desserted on the weekends, and we got the feeling it wasn't so safe to be walking around there at night. we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: MindyPDX
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a weekend and the Club Quarters was perfect for our stay. It was in a great location...walking distance to all the sights we wanted to see (Freedom trail, Quincy Market, T stop to Fenway) Modern rooms with comfy bed. On the small size, the bathroom as well (especially the shower) but we aren't too picky so it worked out great. It is mainly a business travelers' hotel so it wouldn't be good for families. It is located in the financial district and none of the cafes and coffee shops (even starbucks!) are open on weekends. But just a quick walk to the market and there is plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful”
Reviews.Author: BicoastalCa
Reviews.Content: I wasn't able to sleep at this hotel. The door between rooms was not sound-proofed, and TV in the adjoining room was turned up all the way. Though I called the front desk twice about it, they were unable to hear the TV from the hallway and therefore didn't do anything about it. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, staff is not friendly”
Reviews.Author: fsjfoiejsoijr3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights booked by a company for which I was doing some consulting work. The actual rooms are pretty nice, with flat-screen TVs and nice beds. Like others have said, the bathrooms do not have tubs, just showers. The bathrooms are relatively clean, but definitely worn from use. The staff is not particularly helpful, and the services such as WiFi cannot be counted on to work when you are there. If you don't expect too much, you won't be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: traveler_LA
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little wary, but given the price, Club Quarters went beyond my expectations. The location could not be more convenient, and the recently renovated rooms boast granite counters, a small flat screen TV, and free wireless & printing. The hotel supplies free bottled water, which is a nice extra. Some warnings: the rooms are small (think Manhattan small) and are best suited for 1 or 2 adults, rather than families. Parking is 2 blocks away and runs $10/night on weekends ($8 with hotel validation). Our check in was late at night on a Friday of a busy holiday weekend, and the on duty staff person was incredibly helpful. However, he was an exception - the staff we talked to during the rest of our stay couldn't be less interested in being of assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are RUDE”
Reviews.Author: LucyEH
Reviews.Content: Ok, I love the Club Quarters in Boston it is a quick walk almost anywhere near Fanueil Hall. However, the staff were soooooo rude. This had never happened to us before and I have to wonder if the woman on duty was just having a bad day. We decided to stay an extra night and the woman acted like she was doing me a giant favor though... she didn't speak to me the WHOLE time... not one word. I will stay there again because it is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor...look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: kavu
Reviews.Content: Went on a short business trip to Boston and did not have a good experience with this hotel. The people at the main desk were rude (two of them on different days!). The promised free wireless did not work at nights. The night people didn't know how to reset it properly. One of them told me she wouldn't do it because it would kick anyone else who was online on my floor off the network...Given that I had work to do, I insisted over the course of a half hour. An hour later (and several calls), I was told that it was reset. It still didn't work. Then she told me that the system was actually broken and had been for a while (it worked during the day of course). What am I 10 years old? The walls were paper thin and the staff (never mind other patrons) was loud in the hallway. The shower was a joke. The water pressure was basically just gravity. In all, it sucked. I won't do it again, and can't recommend it to anyone else either.

Reviews.Title: “Streamlined Perfection”
Reviews.Author: nychas
Reviews.Content: Great location. I was able to walk to Government Center, North Station, Faneuil Hall, South Station, The Common, Newbury Street. Room was small by U.S. standards but very clean and well appointed. Shower only no tub. Great water pressure. Comfortable bed. Checkin via machine makes the process a breeze. The checkout machines did not work the morning I left but I was out of there in less than a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: indyfemaletraveler
Reviews.Content: With CQ member privileges, staying at the CQ-Boston ($75 for double occupancy) was a no-brainer after looking at other comparable hotels' prices. Still, I was a little nervous after reading some reviewers' complaints. I'm not sure if we stayed at the same hotel. All of the front desk staff was extremely helpful, incl a friendly staffer who helped out with a late-night food order when I realized that there were no restaurants open nearby. I had arrived late and the staff took care of my luggage so I could meet a friend for drinks at the connecting bar. Having the Elephant and Castle right under the hotel was great. I had plenty of chances for a quick drink after a day of sightseeing or a quick coffee before starting. CQ's location was more than convenient - two blocks from a T-stop (the line with a direct stop at the airport) and just a few blocks from Quincy Market, the Freedom Trail, the Aquarium, Fanheuil (sp?) Hall. I even walked to Newberry Street without a fuss. The jr room was spacious, with an open central area and a large bathroom (though it had a standing shower and not a tub). Enjoyed the flat-screen tv and free Wifi, though I didn't hang out in the room much, and the bed was comfortable. All in all, I'm not sure what other guests were looking for but I found quite the deal with the CQ-Boston and am sure the next time I head to Boston that I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “no water in the club quarters”
Reviews.Author: mrobinsmaine
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay, there was no water for 5 hrs. Had no recourse but to submit, when checking in, had no where else to go, was late to an appointment, could not shower, flush toilet etc. Still, was charged full price, and no apology, just snotty attitude, I'm nobody, no one. People take my money, but I just don't matter :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: greatgatsby
Reviews.Content: Location and price are very hard to beat, even independtly of each other. I recommend the hotel for anybody, although it is really a hotel targetting business travelers. It is very modern, clean, efficient. Excellent value, too. It has nice touches like the free water bottles you can take along and the free wireless or the free printing facility. The rooms are not very large, but that should not be an issue in Boston I guess. Best of all is the location, literally just a few steps from the State station of the T. You could not be more central, it is really surprisingly good value for money. I have never stayed at a better value-for-money place in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Better off going Priceline....4 star hotel (Copley Marriott) for $99 vs. $139”
Reviews.Author: Susie19
Reviews.Content: Barebones hotel with uncomfortable beds. Elevators are frequently very slow as well. For the price, I would go to Price line and put in 3 star hotel for a lower price. Chances are you will get a MUCH better hotel for less money. I have stayed here before because I thought it was an inexpensive way to stay in the city. In reality, you can do better. We got Thursday and Friday night rooms for $99 at the Copley Marriott. Basic Club Quarter rooms for the same nights were $139 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel; Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: turtle211
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Club Quarters during a Saturday night in January. First impression of this place was the service was very rude. Upon arrival my boyfriend asked the check-in clerk whether he would be okay parking on the street in front of the hotel. Our reply was a mumbled, " I don't know, you have to read the signs". Shouldn't it be the job of the hotel staff to be able to answer these questions? The staff was neither helpful or accomodating. Check-in took longer than necessary, even though we were the only ones checking-in at the time. And the clerk neglected to tell us you had to put your room key in the elevator in order to get to your floor. The room was fine. Clean. Small, but adequate. Fine for a one night stay. Short on supplies (ie. one towel). I found the bed to be uncomfortable. And the jack-hammering the next morning outside did not help my restless sleep. The price - $86/night could not be beat. This is probably due to the fact that the hotel is located in the Financial District which during the weekend is dead. This hotel is good for the business traveler or budget conscious. But based on the poor service, I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “loved club quarters”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelingirl
Reviews.Content: stayed here Dec. 23-25. Staff was very helpful and check in did not take long at all. They even have machines to check you in if you have a reservation. The bed was very comfortable and clean. Our room was a good size but was right next to the elevators so you could hear people coming and going. Other than that there was nothing else to complain about. The hotel is a two minute walk to faneuil hall maketplace. Would diffenently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible night”
Reviews.Author: medea507
Reviews.Content: I had the most horrible experience staying in that "hotel". The rooms are tiny, but more importantly, one can hear everything coming from the neighboring rooms as there are huge gaps under the doors. But not just hear, also feel! I did not get a minute of sleep for several hours after 1 am, as I had several very vocal couples in the rooms next to mine. I could hear everything, and also my bed was shaking! Apparently the walls are not very thick and the beds are attached to the walls. I noticed that there were only about 3 rooms occupied on that floor, and for some reason, all guests were assigned to the rooms closely adjacent to each other. The heating system in the rooms had only two functioning settings, on and off, which meant temperatures rivalling Sahara desert, or a pitch cold room. Hairdryer in the bathroom was not working. The staff in the front desk were as intrusive and rude as possible. I am a 40 yr woman working in higher education, stayed in that "hotel" alone, and had the worst hotel experience of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: xJessx
Reviews.Content: My husband gets corporate rates with CQ so we booked two nights there in December. The location was fantastic and the rooms was very clean and bathroom spotless. The bed itself was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Club Quarters”
Reviews.Author: Lulu59
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience in this hotel. The room was spacious and very clean. The plasma TV on the wall was a very nice and unexpected touch as this is not an expensive hotel and quite the contrary, as the price was so good, we really did not anticipate such nice accomodations and excellent location. The room had designer bedding, and was very comfortable. This is definitely a no-frills hotel but that is fine with us as there is so much to see in Boston, we did not anticipate using any hotel amenities. We care about comfort and service, and they offered plenty of that. The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. We had to rely on them numerous times for assistance concerning travel around town and they went out of their way to be accomodating. The breakfast next door in the pub was very no-frills, but as it was complimentary, we could not complain. This hotel is literally within two blocks walking distance to Fanuil Hall, and just blocks from the Freedom Trail and the Waterfront. Overall, we highly recommend Club Quarters and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: Digbeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on a mixed business/tourist trip. Check-in and check-out were via automated system, so other than getting a cab called to the airport I had no interaction at all with the staff - which suited me fine. Room was smallish - fine for 2 of us but I would imagine perfect if one was on one's own. Aside from the bed and a fridge, there was a small desk and chair. Very small bathroom (not much more than a closet!), but again fine. I did notice a bit of noise through the door to the hallway, and especially from the elevators - which beeped away all night. On the third floor I noticed that there was a room right beside the elevators. If you had this room my advice would be to head straight to reception and demand another as I think it could be very noisy. Elevators also got ridiculously busy in the mornings, and it's one of those hotels that don't have stair access to the lobby. So despite being only 2 floors from ground I had to let 4 full elevator cars pass before I could fit in one. A small problem but annoying when it happens every morning! Attached "Elephant and Castle" pub was friendly and efficient place for snacks and drinks, and very handy given that the hotel is in a quiet business district with not a lot else to hand. Two blocks from Government Center T-stop, and 10 min walk to Park St so it was pretty easy to get around. But then it's pretty easy to get around Boston anyway. Also easy walking distance for Boston Common, Faneuil Hall, so location pretty good. Best feature however was the cost, this moves this hotel from average to above average. Very decent rate ($100 I think), especially at the weekend when the business travellers move out. It also seems to be a bit of a hidden gem. I've frequently found vacancies at the Club Quarters when all the Back Bay hotels have been full. Given the choice I'd probably stay somewhere else, but if I was on a budget and looking for a good, clean, place to stay it would be top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: divasmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitly geared to the business traveler, we were there on pleasure. Check in and check out were slow due to problems with the automated system and they don't have the desk staff to handle everyone manually. This is one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in which is much appreciated as I am a light sleeper. The bathroom is too small for 2 people to use at the same time. The room was small but not especially for Boston. While the business traveller will appreciate the wireless connection, etc. for the pleasure traveller the room felt stripped down. We got a good deal through priceline, but when I called to make sure I had a non smoking room, the person gave me attitude about booking through priceline. Also the number for the hotel was listed incorrectly (I'm assuming it was an incorrect number since it rings and rings and no one answers). It took some detective work to find the real number. In the future I'll limit myself to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “The most Incompetent Customer Service ever”
Reviews.Author: jedoucette
Reviews.Content: This hotel was flooded on October 7, 2006 by a water main break. We were scheduled to stay on October 8 and luckily saw this on the news and cancelled our reservation by calling customer service. We followed up twice to confirm our concellation because the people we spoke to sounded so clueless that we had an uneasy feeling. A week later (of course) we were charged for our room. I spent a few hours on the phone with these people once again and they still have not agreed to reverse my charge (yet). I've never dealt with such incompetence - the desk staff sound like they were just pulled off the street and are so clueless. Since this chain's member services are operated out of a single location, and I have called and spoken to at least a half dozen of these people, I can only assume that this whole operation is bush league. Avoid all of these hotels

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Mommasue
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely difficult to locate. The directions we received from booking were incorrect. Locals, including police , could not help and the hotel gave inaccurate derections as well. We were in the correct neighborhood and took 2 hours to locate the hotel. There is no on site parking. Parking is nearby but upon departure we had to pay $60 for 22 hours of parking. The hotel did not offer us any validation to decrease cost. Hotel was nice but suprisingly sparse. Only one towel per guest with no washcloths or hand towels. Coffee maker was for one cup only. The room was clean and comfortable, but the view was of the back of a building. The attached restaurant was good and the staff willingly changed our room when we were assigned twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Club Quarters in Boston and I like this hotel. I stayed two night from Saturday Sept 23, 2006 to Monday Sept 25, 2006. Price was US$119 per night plus tax (US$267.62 for the two nights including taxes).. I arrived early as I had just come off a cruise ship. No problem getting into my room straight away. I was in room 213. Fitness centre was just down the hall. Room was clean and I liked the flat screen TV. Room and bathroom were quite small but a lot larger than the cabin that I had on the ship. Coffee machine in the room with extra free supplies of coffee and tea in the hall closet Nice lounge with free internet use. I had the Sunday breakfast buffet next door in the Elephant & Castle. US$16 per person. Good selection and friendly service.. The hotel location is excellent and close to the Freedom trail and all its attractions. State metro is close by and it is just 3 stops to the airport. I like Club Quarters automated check in/out. It is quick, efficient and avoids having to wait in line at reception. Room was quiet being the weekend but even on Monday morning there was little noise. Overall, an enjoyable stay at a good price and I will stay there again. andrew

Reviews.Title: “Good vlue, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: osk77
Reviews.Content: OK the value is good and the hotel is reasonably priced, but the service is terrible. I was waiting 10 min at the erception desk for the guy to figure out whether there was a clean room available or not. That place is a mess. Rooms are clean and nice, but bear in mind you just pay for lodging, service does not seem to be included.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Russellicious
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel in Boston for three nights from 08/18-08/21, while on vaction with my girlfriend. The hotel room was extremely small, but adequate. The shower is barely large enough for one person to fit in. The room was extremely clean and the bed was comfortable. We didn't hear any noise from other rooms, however the noise of other passing guests in the hallways was clearly evident and obnoxiously loud at times. The hotel is located in the financial district which is quiet on the weekends other than other tourists who are milling around. The hotel is in an excellent location for tourists as it is only a couple of blocks from the freedom trail, the T (Subway), and a short walk to the north end (Little Italy section). The area appears very safe with the exception of a few homeless individuals. We parked our car in the hotel's recommended parking garage a block away and it was $40 for the three nights (You park your own car and have the ticket validated by the hotel desk for a discount.) Getting to Fenway Park for the Yankees' victory was easy. The hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. We ate at the restaurant next to the hotel (Elephant and Castle) for breakfast one morning. I equate it to airport food. It was quick and edible, but not the best food we've ever had. I paid $180 a night on Price Line and I'd say that was a fair price. You're primarily paying for the location, not the hotel amenities. Try Abe & Louie's if you're looking for a great steakhouse that's on the expensive side. It's a $9 cab ride away and well worth the trip if you can afford the tab ($190 for two with wine and tip.) The freedom trail was very interesting and I highly recommend it. It's approximately 3 miles of walking with many historical sites along the way. It also takes you past many interesting shops as well as great restaurants. Boston was a nice trip that was definitely worth taking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Courteous”
Reviews.Author: vicky95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a weekend in Boston. We paid $125 per nigh through priceline and had a GREAT experience there. The men at the front desk were very helpful with food reccomendations and they gave us an upgrade to a suite. The room was very nice with a cool flat screen tv. The suite has a microwave, bar sink and small refrigerator. I must say that the bathroom was a little small.The Elephant and Castle bar adjacent to the hotel had great food and good entertainment on the weekend. We spend most of our time out on the wharf and Faneuil Hall. It was a quick walk, less than a mile. The area was clean and safe. For the money I spent, I got a great value, great service and had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, reasonable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Twiglet2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the July heatwave. The rooms were fine - clean, not overly-spacious but big enough. They do seem to have a problem with towels here! We had to ask for extras as they only provided enough for one person and even again on the 2nd day when housekeeping removed 2 sets and replaced only 1. We thought the restaurant and bar next door were over-priced and the quality of the food was average at best. The hotel itself is within walking distance of most attractions - if you enjoy walking (we do). The area felt perfectly safe to me. I think we must have missed the 'breakfasts' in the morning - there was coffee and usually cookies but nothing else (7am - 8am).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: blondie62
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son & I spent the night in Boston before we took the Amtrak to Maine the next day. They don't have 2 dbl beds but have rollways, so I reserved a full and rollway. Wanted to be near Fanuil Hall and Quincy Market. Very modern! Flat screen TV, nice clean bathroom,comfortable mattress. Rooms are small but nice,definately for one person,though! If I came to visit alone I'd stay here again. One disappointment no mini fridge in room! They do have a nice restaurant & Pub attached. Watched the Red Sox game, while my son watched a movie in the room. They also serve breakfast in the morning. Took a cab to North station the folling morning.Kind of far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Malfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over 4th July 2006, and were really pleased with both the location and the hotel itself. When we arrived the lobby was a little chaotic - but its a small lobby and this was probably their busiest weekend of the year and we checked in fine with no hitches. On arrival day there was only one elevator working - our room was only the the 2nd floor so we would have happily taken the stairs but we were told that there were not any that we could use - so we were left to wait around a lot for the remaining working elevator. The elevator was fixed after about 36 hours and this was only a minor inconvenience so we were not too concerned. Our room was a good size, nicely decorated, very clean and with a very comfortable bed. Our room was at the front of the building overlooking the street and on just the 2nd floor - but the street was so quiet that it did not disturb us at all. The lounge was pleasant and nicely furnished with a big TV, 2 computers with free internet and lots of leaflets and magazines with local information. Location was great - near to the Freedom Trail, marketplace, downtown etc and just a few minutes walk from a subway station (just 3 stops to the airport). Generally the street and the area felt very safe, both in day and evening time. The Elephant and Castle next door was convenient - we ate there on our first night as we had arrived late and found the staff friendly, the food good and the service quick. They were however closing down for a few weeks for refurbishment when we were there. Overall, if you are looking for a functional, convenient, affordable hotel in central Boston this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to all”
Reviews.Author: MargaretRj
Reviews.Content: Going through Hotwire, we found ourselves with a room at this hotel. After reading some of the reviews, I expected the worse. Surprise! The staff, while not the most engaging, were not rude at all. They were helpful and responded quickly to our concerns. We liked the room we were given..yes, it was small but it was quiet, clean, the bathroom was more than adequate (though they could be a little more generous with the towels), and the bed was very comfortable. Since I am not that fond of constant air-conditioning, the ability to open the window was a plus! And free wireless internet is always a welcome treat. Coffee, juices, and breakfast fare (cookies, fruit, muffins and danishes) were available in the Club Room in the morning. And while parking is not free, a 20% discount is available with the hotel's validation of your ticket. We were able to walk easily to most sights--the Common, North End, Quincy Market-- and the various T lines were just a short walk away. I would have rated this hotel above average but because the hotel is located in the Financial District, I did feel some trepidation walking back there at night. It was a little too quiet and desolate for me, even when walking with my husband. (Otherwise, the area did appear very safe).

Reviews.Title: “perfect for crashing”
Reviews.Author: ReginaFillangie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Quarters Boston for 3 nights end of May. I had read the mixed reviews on this site and was a little apprenhensive. All in all it was absolutely fine: I had trouble checking in but I think that was Orbitz rather than the hotel itself. The lady behind the desk was efficient and invited me to wait in their club room while she sorted it out. The room itself was larger than expected, comfy bed and the bathroom was above average - ok you get a shower rather than a bath but who's going to be relaxing in a bath all night if you're in town to see the sights? I liked the very modern flat screen TV and the room was quiet EXCEPT for the g*d damn elevator bell ringing every time the elevator passed the eighth floor, regardless of whether it stopped or not. Tip: do not stay in any of 01 rooms ie 301, 801 - you'll get the elevator bell 24/7. I only ordered room service once which was breakfast on Sunday morning provided by the pub next door. It was ok but nothing spectacular. I wasn't that bothered myself as I was purely using the hotel as a place to sleep and freshen up. If I had been spending more time in my hotel or staying longer I'd probably go somewhere else. The staff were friendly and efficient and the location was FANTASTIC - less than 5 mins walk to Quincy market. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious? No. Location? Great. P”
Reviews.Author: AntsInMyPantsDE
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a grand club quarters experience, you'll find the understaffed Club Quarters Boston isn't going to make you stay amazing. The location, however, compared to suburbian hotels for just fifty dollars less a night in many cases, will make your stay here worth it! You are literally two blocks away from the Freedom Trail, down in the financial district on a safe Central business district road. Checking in took us some time. We got there on a Friday night. One elavator wasn't working. The card machine for rooms wasn't working well either. The two gentlemen working the front desk were very courtious and apologetic. They were doing the best anyone could do checking in hoards of guests, dealing with grumpy businessmen who could stand having to wait a minute or two for the one working elevator, manning the phones, conceirge requests, etc. They did this all in a very professional manner. The room was small and economical. You get two towels, one wash cloth, one hand towel, two pillows, a comfy bed, small TV, mini fridge, shower (no bath,) coffee machine and that's it. You'll not get anything extra here. So if you're OK with that (my fiance and I were) you'll be fine. If you''re higher maintenence, you'll hate this place. The only reason I rate the Club Quarters with an average score, rather than above average considering their location, was because of our check out experience. A wedding party was staying at the hotel that weekend as well. When we checked out one woman who was cold as ice was "helping" (or not helping) the Mother-of-the-Bride with reservations that had been messed up in their system. For 5-10 minutes this woman went from not being able to help the mother to fixing it once she figured out how. She had a chip on her shoulder, made everyone else in the lobby wait without any awknowledgement, including the Fedex service who had a package for the bride. In front of the mother of the bride, she tried to look the bride's name up in the system and asked the mother (still waiting for the one elevator) if she knew this guest. Yes, it was the bride. After spending that long helping the wedding party, how can she not know? Wouldn't any hotel have the wedding party's name at the front desk? If you're looking for a place to host an event, DO NOT do it here! This woman clearly did not care about service, karma, kindness, people, anything....cold as ice. So that's the impression I left with.

Reviews.Title: “Stingy with normal supplies”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is indeed stingy. The "Guest request closet" was almost entirely empty- no pillows, no blankets, no irons- only a few coffee packets on the door. When I called down to the desk to request an additional pillow, they said they had run out of pillows. What kind of hotel runs out of pillows??? That said, decor was nice, the beds comfortable, and location good.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do, DO NOT stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read good and bad reviews about the service at this hotel before I made the reservation. I figured for the price i was paying, if the clerks were rude, that would not really matter to me because we would be sightseeing most of the time and would not be in the hotel anyway. I was wrong. I found out friendly and quality service is something that is very important to me. The clerks were very arrogant, rude, unhappy, and unhelpful. I made several requests and it fell on deaf ears. There were two people staying in our room. They had initially stocked the room with one towel and one washcloth. Repeated requests for more linens each day only brought one more towel and one more washcloth. They are very stingy with the linens. The restaurant near the lobby, Elephant and Castle, is very very bad. The servers were friendly enough, but the service was very very slow and the food was not very good. We would not stay there again, ever. However, the room/hotel was clean and it was in a very good location. Only three blocks from the subway and about six blocks from Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market. If you are looking for friendly clerks and quality service, this is NOT the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent price $82.00, was supposed to be 1 double bed, turned out to be a KING size bed, that was extremely comfy with a down comforter and down pillows. Bathroom was great and the place was clean. Automated Check in/out worked fine and was fast and easy. Loved it, what a bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Had some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed w/2 friends at Club Quarters in Boston. The location is great and the rooms weren't too bad, but we had some problems. We got in Thur night and they did not have a room ready for us so they transferred us to Seaport which wouldn't have been a problem except that I had an important interview the next morning at 10am. B/c of the mix up and check out times at the other hotel I had to push my interview back to 2pm. Then when we arrived back at CQ they still didn't have a room for us so I had to get ready for my interview in the public restroom on the 2nd floor (no shower of course). They did pay for a cab to take us into Waltham which was nice, but it didn't really make up for the fact that we lost a whole day of activities due to the mix up. When we finally got back that night we got into our room only to find out that there was only one bed when we had made it very clear that we needed 2 beds. So, they brought us a cot that was more like a torture device than a bed. On the last night they finally got us into a room with 2 beds but we had to unpack and repack 3 times throughout our 3 day stay. When we checked out we asked to speak to a manager to see what they could do about our inconvenience and we were basically told that since we booked thru priceline there was nothing they could do for us. They were actaully kind of rude about it and the manager just stood there while another girl did all the talking. We got the feeling that it had more to do with us not being corporate clients than booking through priceline, but who knows. My conclusion is that this a is a fine hotel for business travelers but if you are going on vacation pay a little extra for a hotel with more amenities and better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: JDGS92
Reviews.Content: When we read the other reviews on this web site we were wary! However, our stay was marvelous. We were allowed to check in early (1:15, rather than 3:00)and upgraded to an "executive suite". This included a minifridge, microwave, desk, couch, and two televisions! (High-speed internet, too, I believe, but we did not use that) We liked that your room key card also operates the elevator. A nice extra sense of security. There is a nice "club room" to sit in with comfy sofas and a gas fire place. There is also a gym (we did not check it out, however.) Right next door is a great restaurant, The Elephant and Castle. it has a decent Sunday brunch buffet. Also, great central location, near all the Freedom Trail sights, Chinatown, and shopping. Staff was very nice, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're only planning on sleeping there”
Reviews.Author: LadyBirdBerson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our weekend in Boston, where we stayed at the Club Quarters. We were booked a "standard room" through Travelocity (or one of the similar sites), which ended up being a room with a full size bed (they do give you any other option on any website). Before even getting up to our room, we asked if there was any way we could be moved to something with a queen size bed, as my boyfriend is very tall. Without hesitation, we were given keys to rm 317, which ended up being the executive suite. It sounds a whole lot jazzier than it really is. It was about the size of a regular hotel room, with a tiny kitchen area. We were certainly not going to complain. It was more than enough for us. We were only sleeping and getting ready in the room. We did have some problems Saturday night with the heat, as it was snowing like mad outside. They sent someone up to fix it. The bathroom was small, but it was clean, and the shower was hot and had good pressure. The Club Room was nice, as they had a computer with internet and a large TV. The pub next door was convenient, and had decent food. Note: late check out will cost you $30- $66. Leaving bags at the reception after check out costs $1 a bag, which I thought to be kind of crappy. All that being said, it was in a great location and we were warm and comfortable. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were shocked to find out that the hotel does not offer valet parking, nor does it have its own parking lot! We were sent to a parking lot approximately 2 blocks away and had to lug our large suitcases through the busy streets ourselves (parking cost $40 overnight). While the hotel was conveniently located, the room was so incredibly small and the staff was only mildly helpful. While we were struggling to get our luggage through the two main doors, the desk clerk literally climbed over us to get outside instead of helping us. Ridiculous! You really do get what you pay for, which is why this was the least expensive hotel in downtown Boston. We will definitely not stay at this hotel when we return.

Reviews.Title: “convenient but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed last weekend for parent's weekend. The price of the room was reasonable, compared to many others. Prices that weekend can jump $100 per night. The staff is not particularly friendly, and the lobby is miniscule. Our first room was right in front of the elevator. We asked to be moved and were accomodated. Our next room was fine until our neighbors came back to their room at 3 am. I know that their rudeness is not the fault of the hotel, but the level of noise that seeps through the walls is. I was kept awake by the crys of our neighbor, who wanted to know (repeatedly) why her boyfriend didn't love her. I had a few suggestions for her (drunk and disorderly, whiney, needy). The hotel is within walking distance of Quincy Market, the Northend, and the Government Center, where we caught the T.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Priceline and let me tell you, if you are at all picky about your hotels, NEVER use Priceline. The first thing we noticed is that the room was EXTREMELY tiny. The end of the bed was probably three feet from the wall. About the bed...My wife is 5'5' and layed down on the bed with her head on the pillow and her feet were off the bed. We asked for a queen or king size bed and I think it was a double bed. I felt like I was in a room especially for "little people". The room was also not very clean. The only positive is that it is near a lot. We cut our losses and left after 10 minutes. Priceline and Club Quarters would not help us with a refund. We went to the Hyatt Cambridge which was a GREAT hotel for the same price after using out AAA card. An expensive night, but well worth changing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here the first weekend of October. I got a discount through the university I work for and payed $149 per night. I think this hotel is overpriced, but considering prices of other hotels thoughout Boston, in hindsight, I feel we got a (pretty good) deal. I searched and searched the internet, and this was the best deal I found for the location - which, by the way, is fantastic!! Our room was very tiny, though not a problem at all for us. It was clean, not bland, dingy, or outdated like some others have mentioned. Late at night, you can hear people in the halls and I heard the person in the room next store flushing the toilet. The food in the pub downstairs is so-so. That being said, I would stay in this hotel again. Like I said, the location was fabulous, the neighborhood clean and walkable with little traffic and the room was clean and pretty nice. The only reason I wouldn't stay is if I found a better priced hotel (that had a good rating).....Boston is a great town and I can't wait to go back !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price Great location”
Reviews.Author: abby_GA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of the month. We did not get to the hotel until almost 1 in the morning. We went to the desk to check in and they told us we had to use the automatic machine instead. It did not like our credit card so we went back to the front desk, he was not happy to see us but did get us checked in. We then went up to our room and realized they had given us a double bed instead of the king. The first room was not very clean and you could hear the tv very loud from the room next door. We were given a new room with a king bed and the room was much better. There is not much space in the room but who goes to stay in the room the whole time? We were very happy with the new room. You are close to all 4 lines of the subway which was very easy to use. We were also just blocks from the market and shopping in all directions. The area the hotel was in was the financial district and since we were there on the weekend it was very quite. A great irish pub is located right outside the hotel. We had a great time and for the money the hotel did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Riverbankannie
Reviews.Content: Stayed just for one night in August. Found hotel to be unwelcoming, room bland and not prepared for 2 guests (one water glass, one tea bag, one half and half). Rang reception to ask for more and was brought just an extra glass. No refreshments of any sort available in hotel. Breakfast was in adjacent "pub" style bar, dingy and gloomy and had to be paid for separately.

Reviews.Title: “The English Pub and the self cleaning room key.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean smart Hotel in a very good location to see the sights of Boston. Staff were friendly if a little too eager to direct you to the auto check in/out machines. The room was clean and functional with everything you would want for a budget stay. Be careful with your room key as we and others found that if kept in your wallet they would loose the room info very easily requiring a trip to reception. The 'English Pub' next door was very pleasant but NOT English in the slightest (selling Newcastle Brown Ale doesnt count!), not witnessed many Irish Kareoke' nights before ! Well worth staying at!

Reviews.Title: “Not a destination, but great base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: PTHYPE
Reviews.Content: Here is the straight skinny on the CQ Boston --> It is built for BUSINESS travelers, and as such, it is a wonderful place -- the rooms are small and clean. There is an attached pub (Elephant and Castle) where one can get a cold beer and some acceptable grub after a long day of meetings in the financial district if there is no desire to go exploring Boston. Wireless connectivity that is free, no strings attached all over the hotel. A family on vacation here would be quite miserable in one room, they are far too small. A young couple intent on exploring the city and using the hotel as a base of operations rather than as a destination would be quite happy here. As far as location goes, you are less than 5 minutes from Fanueil Hall and the bevy of tourist traps there (Durgin Park seafood being the noteworthy exception), the North End and the wonderful Italian Pastry shops are just 10 minutes walk, and the Blue Line is less than 2 blocks away. Overall, a destination hotel this is NOT. As a clean, comfortable base for adventuresome duos this is perfect. One negative -- the elevator is a disaster...small, slow, and one was out of service

Reviews.Title: “bad attitude by the staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeff03
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed in the service in the Boston Clubquarters on 7/1/05. I had booked 2 rooms through Hotels for 7/1. When I arrived, I found that only 1 room had been reserved for me. The desk agent was not very helpful over the next 3 hours in resolving the situation. Finally, I called Hotels customer service, got the agent to talk to your desk clerk, found that it was clubquarters error and got the second room. It took about 4 hours to get a rollaway bed in one room and only 1 of 2 elevators were working, making for long waits for an elevator. Overall, an unpleasant experience. The staff was not welcoming or helpful with my problems. I won't stay here again and don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: TaraR
Reviews.Content: I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel. This hotel is conveniently located between State Stree and Downtown Crossing T stops - both about 2-3 blocks away. (The airport was only about 3 T stops away). The hotel is only a few blocks from Boston Commons, the Freedom Trail and Quincy Market. We had 2 people in their smallest room (one double bed) but we had more than enough space for our 3 nights. Rooms were clean, the bed and pillows were comfortable and the bathroom was a nice size. We checked in and checked out using the kiosks right inside the door. Not reason enough to decide to stay there - but it was very fast and very nice. The hotel has a nice fitness center that was empty both days we used it. My boyfriend thanked me / complimented me all weekend for choosing such a great hotel, with a great price and great location! Next time I go to Boston, I will stay here again. Actually, I normally use this site for recommendations but got such a good deal and planned the trip last minute that I didn't even check the other reviews. I was very surprised to ready some negative reviews today. I have only nice things to say about the Club Quarters. I stayed at one in Chicago a couple of years ago and found it to be equally as nice.

HotelInfo.Name: Club Quarters Boston
HotelInfo.Address: 161 Devonshire Street, Between Milk & Franklin Streets, Boston, MA 02110
